Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: loll_1
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a long weekend in Rome staying at The Lirico Hotel. Very nice Hotel, clean and comfortable. Had everything we needed, good location and good price. Breakfast was nice and enough to see you through a day of tours and exploring. Would stay here again and recommend to anyone. Organised private transfers to and from the Airport in advance which I would highly recommend. It's 50 euro each way but well worth it and saves being faced with trying to master the buses and metro as soon as you step off the plane. An over all pleasant experience with this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best three stars option in Termini area”
Reviews.Author: dreyes1047
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay at the Lirico, just accross the Opera is a great hotel, the staff is great, the rooms are beautifully decorated and very comfortable, Tony at the front desk is wonderful. Breakfast is nice and plentiful to get you started.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: ana212
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lirico hotel for 4 nights. Nice hotel and good location. Very close to the metro station. When you get there, you'll see a huge flight of stairs but it wasn't an issue for us. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Our room had air conditioner so heating wasn't a problem. Breakfast was good: cakes, bread, croissants, cheese, cold meats ,eggs, different types of juice, milk, tea and coffee. The best part was that the breakfast ladies would make you any type of coffee beverage (macchiato,cappuccino,espresso, etc.). The staff was also very friendly. Tony was the gentleman we'd see in the evening after a long day of sightseeing. He'd recommend local restaurants and answer any of our questions about what to visit and how to get there. I'd also like to mention the breakfast ladies, in particular the lady from Cabo Verde- So nice! I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “lirico hotel rome”
Reviews.Author: dianne m
Reviews.Content: Super little hotel with warm freindly staff. Happy to tell you about trams, trains and buses. Good room, very quiet rooms, can't hear anyone moving or banging doors etc, which is important to us. Breakfasts reasonable, and well presented. Very clean . Would stay here again. Walking distance from all major events, if you are a keen walker.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at the Lirico”
Reviews.Author: poolielass
Reviews.Content: just returned and we spent 3 nights at The Lirico. Yes there are stairs up to the reception but hardly an issue, although no access i could see for disabled visitors which yes this could be a problem so worth contacting hotel. Early check in we arrived at about noon and we were given our key. I requested a room facing the opera house and they had a note of it and we were given room 211 which was spacious enough and a good view. Room and hotel were spotless, maid service each day with clean towels and sheet. Asked for extra pillows which were in our room following our day out. Breakfast basic continental, not alot of room in the breakfast area which was fine for us as it wasnt busy but can imagine it would be cramped in summer. No kettle in room but dont know if this is the norm in Rome. Location fine for Termini - 5 min walk. 10-15 to Quirinale/Trevi area. We walked everywhere and if we were tired coming back we got the metro and got off at Repulicca or Termini. Cafe Strega down the street beer reasonable price 7euro for large and small beer - cheap for Rome! Would we go back yes if i was staying in Termini area, however if i was to go back to Rome would probably stay closer to Trevi/Pantheon area. Any questions about the hotel drop me a note.

Reviews.Title: “Good value Lirico”
Reviews.Author: winfreeman
Reviews.Content: Good rooms, bathrooms and good breakfast with really nice staff. Ideally located to walk to most places.Would use this hotel again without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend the Lirico Hotel Rome”
Reviews.Author: Wendy H
Reviews.Content: Party of eleven stayed for 3 nights from 7th February 2012. Excellent value for hotel within walking distance of most attractions and train terminal making easy transfer to and from airport Rooms clean and bed comfortable, Staff friendly and helpful. breakfast facility very good. Would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: davew40
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights mid February. Excellent position, close to station, metro, walking distance to many of the main attractions. Numerous quality restaurants and bars around the corner, which helped in the sleet and the snow! Hotel is well looked after, cleaned daily and staff are friendly. Plenty of choice for a continental breakfast which is available 7.30 til 10am. Drinks available all day and evening. Only downside for anyone with mobility problems is the flight of steps upto reception. But for us the hotel was ideal and we would definitely return when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable”
Reviews.Author: Young1974
Reviews.Content: My wife and i visited Rome for her birthday surprise at the end of Jan 2012, we stayed for 3 nights, but only wish we had booked for longer. All of the hotel staff were helpful and polite nothing was to much. The grey haired and wise concierge (Tony) was above & Beyond. full of local knowledge and good places to eat. The rooms were in great order and the hotel was very clean and tidy.... we did not understand how it only had a 3 star ratting.we were definitely in 5 star service.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Randy1234
Reviews.Content: For us this Hotel was in a perfect location. All the sites could be reached by walking including the Vatican and Castel Sant Angelo. The metro is a few minute walk away if you prefer to ride the subway to the different locations.The rooms are small but very nice and very clean. The best part of this Hotel was the staff. They were all very nice and took great care of us. The breakfast was good and a great way to start the day off. If you need transfers to and from the airport, just let them know and they will set it all up. We plan on going back and highly recommend the Lirico.

Reviews.Title: “Joy to stay”
Reviews.Author: ni1938
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Roma from December 21 to 27 and stayed at hotel Lirico. The hotel was in a fabulous location and it was really easy to find. Our window overlooked the Opera Theater. The room was clean. The bed was very comfortable just what we needed for rest after a long day of sight seeing. The staff were extremely helpful and family friendly. Overall we had a great stay at hotel Lirico and could not fault them in any aspect. We will stay again if we return to Roma. Also we will strongly recommend this hotel to our friends who decide to visit Rome. This place may not be suitable for seniors or disabled people. 24 stairs lead to the hotel and there is no elevator to get there.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel for decent price in good location, friendly personel”
Reviews.Author: mauriloco
Reviews.Content: Stayed in triple room for three nights, and would definitely consider returning to this hotel in case of returning to Rome, mainly because the price is rather good considering the situation of the hotel, next to the Teatro dell'Opera, and a 2 minute walk from metro station. Colosseum is about 25 minutes walking. Room was okay, nothing special but sufficient, medium quality. Can certainly recommend this hotel to travellers who are not looking for the cheapest nor for the most exclusive, but for travellers who seek 3-4 star, affordable prices and good location it's perfect

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: dc_5York
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Lirico Hotel for 4 nights (27th to 30th November 2011) and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. From Fiumicino airport there is a dedicated train service (30 minute journey) to Rome's central Termini station, the hotel is between 5 to 10 minutes' walk from there. Incidentally the two Metro lines intersect outside Termini station too, so anywhere in Rome is so easy and cheap to get to (one euro for a single ticket!). The hotel itself is spread over three floors (not on the ground floor though). From the street, the first floor Reception is accessed via a short, wide flight of stairs, and the further floors are reached by a lift. This really isn't a problem - anyone struggling to manage a single flight of stairs should think twice about visiting Rome - think seven hills! The hotel is literally next door to the Opera House, making it ideal if your sense of direction is a bit below par and you need to ask for directions back. Our room overlooked the Opera House which is probably the best side to be on. The room was small, as was the bathroom, but perfectly adequate. Yes there are a lot of hotels in central Rome and probably much larger rooms to be had, but certainly not at this price point! It was tidy, well-decorated and furnished and very clean, likewise the bathroom. The bed was comfortable and we slept well every night. Maid service was daily, as were clean towels. We had a decent wall-mounted TV with some English channels and the room had a safe, for which there was a small charge - ten euros for four nights, no complaints there. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful, suggesting restaurants etc. on our way out. Breakfast staff and the breakfast itself were fine too. Rome itself is a fabulous city - so many things to see. Highlights for us were the Colosseum and Roman Forum (amazing they managed to build such structures 2000 years ago), the Pantheon, still in fantastic condition and St. Peter's Basilica. Although we're not religious, the place is awesome in the literal sense of the word. The 320-step climb to the top is not to be missed. Many more amazing sights too numerous to mention. Only bad experience was having a fair amount of money stolen on the Metro, despite being forewarned and taking precautions, but this could happen in any big city. Hats off to the thief or thieves, don't know how they managed it, and so quickly too. But I suppose they do it for a living so should be expert at it! Beware of crowded places and being hemmed in! Weather was excellent, although November is supposed to be the wettest month we didn't see a drop, and it was jackets off in the afternoons. Overall an excellent break and should we visit Rome again we will be going back to the Lirico. Highly recommended and superb value for money.

Reviews.Title: “good for the price...”
Reviews.Author: sakis1969
Reviews.Content: good hotel for a good price near the centre of the city.nice rooms with good amenities good enough breakfast very close to the train station and clean rooms.for 80-100 euros its good. the stuff is helpfull and you will be next to opera

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: BAZZER123
Reviews.Content: We have given the Lirico 5 stars & that is based on the standard of the hotel for the price we paid which was £250 for 4 nights (booking direct with the hotel). We stayed at the Lirico in November & had an enjoyable stay at this good value for money tourist hotel. Some reviewers have complained about the steps up to reception which I cannot understand unless you’re infirm, wheelchair bound or as with a lot of overweight Americans & Brits averse to any type of exercise no matter how minor, but if that is the case why book this hotel. The rooms are clean but on the small size but this is a city hotel & time spent in the room is minimal. Breakfast was of a good standard with plenty of yoghurt & fresh fruit plus the usual continental breakfast fare. All of the staff we encountered including the staff at breakfast were very friendly & helpful, reception staff only advised us about bars & restaurants if we enquired, & didn't give the impression as suggested in another review that they did so because of some kind of kick back (but if the restaurant was good would that matter?). The hotel is within easy walking distance of all the major tourist sites & because the weather was so beautiful we didn't use public transport preferring to walk everywhere. Restaurants close to the major tourist attractions tend to be more expensive & not as good as the ones located near the hotel, we used one across the main road from the Irish bar & up a side road which had very palatable house wine at 8 euros a bottle, great pizzas & pasta & on our last visit they threw in free brochette & coffee & the bill which included 2 bottles of wine & an 'extravagant' sea food pasta for me still came in at less than 40 euros! If whilst out during the day you want to picnic, the Spar situated on the main road leading down into the centre of Rome has a good deli & 1Ltr cartons of quaffable wine for just over a one & a half euros. We had a fantastic time in Rome a beautiful city full of friendly people; I definitely want to go back & would definitely stay at The Lirico.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed, clean and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: cpl727
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister and would be happ to return on my own. This is a friendly, unpretentious hotel and excellent value for money. It's conveniently situated within walking distance of Termini railway station. Many of the attractions are within walking distance and there are bus stops nearby. There's plenty of choice of eating places nearby as well. The room was very clean and the staff all very helpful. The hotel is quiet, with only the occasional street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, shame about the breakfast !”
Reviews.Author: lmax07
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well placed, less than 10 minutes walk from the Termini, and within reasonable walking distance to most sites (colloseum, forum, palantine hill etc). The vatican is a bus ride away but is walkable for keen walkers. The rooms were comfortable and clean and well presented. As others have found, the stairs up to the reception are a draw back but a lot of hotels have a similar configuration. The weak point for us was the breakfast. The croissants were often "overcooked" or "burnt" and not as fresh as they should have been. The reception staff were friendly but the breakfast room staff were not. The Roma Pass is definitely worthwhile and would recommend it. It covers more than you would think.

Reviews.Title: “Lirico Hotel, Roma”
Reviews.Author: G-Carlin
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 5 day midweek break at this hotel. We stayed in room 201 which was a little small but had a huge comforable bed. The room and bathroom were very, very clean and the towels were changed every day. Cannot fault this accomodation at all. The staff were very friendly and helpful - Tony was especially nice. Breakfast was in a small room and was buffet style - plenty of choice here with cereals, fruit and jam, rolls and croissants, yoghurt and cold meats and boiled eggs. Tea and cofffee were freshly made and brought to your table. The hotel is in a quieter area than surrounding streets and only a ten minute walk from Termini - its possible to walk to all the major tourist sites. We even walked to St Peters and back when the Metro was off. A great hotel for the money - we booked the flights (Ryanair) and hotel through Travel Republic and couldnt beat the price. Well done to ALL the staff at the Hotel Lirico. We had a great stay in Rome. Great weather and no queues at any of the attractions we visited.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable prices and best location”
Reviews.Author: GREEKSTORYTELLER
Reviews.Content: Best location for this hotel,great view and good service even though rooms are small.However,its ideal for couples who want to have attractions close. Recommended for sure.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon review- perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jaemerson
Reviews.Content: we wanted location and we got it! Got a little lost on walk from train to hotel (take a good map on the plane with you!- - do not need a taxi!) Super clean and amazing sounds from the opera house below. safe, strollable area- with a great rome vibe. still will need a taxi to most places- but that is typical in a big city like Rome. The front desk is just ok- dont expect concierage type services. The breakfast was perfect each morning. We felt happy and relieved to have found Lirico!

Reviews.Title: “clean, good value, lovely hosts, amazing location-perfectimo!!”
Reviews.Author: LuvtotravelUK
Reviews.Content: the hotel is right in the heart of rome, everything felt like a 5 minute walk away! Tony greeted us on arrival and was just lovely, huge smile on his face and knows how to recommend good places to eat! Rooms were amazingly clean and warm, the decor was authentic, breakfast was simple but all you need! Would def recommend to a friend and cant wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place”
Reviews.Author: 1ChrisK1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on the last night of our Italian adventure. I thought it was in a great location, the rooms were a decent size and were very clean. I'd definitely check it out my next time through.

Reviews.Title: “steer clear”
Reviews.Author: ajhc100
Reviews.Content: great for the train station, meaning you can walk it with your luggage but then on arriving , you are faced with a load of steps and no lift. what a nightmare. if your over 20 years of age and dont look like the young arny shcwarzenegger, then you've had it! Lots of internal steps and no lift! once your on the 1st floor, then there is a lift. The free drink is nothing but an ornage juice - big deal!! The owner is unfriendly and unwelcoming. Rooms, basic and tight. The web artist has done a great job making this place look great, when the reality is different. Wouldnt reccomend this place to anyone. we toured italy and this was the least attractive place. Disapointed at the less than helpful and cold attitude of the owner. Ok if you want to be near the train station - but thats it. The area seems a bit dodgy and the hotel itself looks run down.

Reviews.Title: “Would choose it again”
Reviews.Author: steddiguy
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a 4 night stay in Rome at the Lirico which was an excellent base. The hotel is well located to get to and to explore Rome. It is about 10 minutes walk from the Terminii station and easy to find. Attractions: 20 minutes walk to the Colosseum and Forum and the Spanish Steps, 30 minutes to the Pantheon, 45 minutes to the St Peters Square and 50-55 minutes to the Vatican Museum entrance. My partner and enjoy walking but the staff on reception can advise you on transport. The surrounding area also has a number of reasonably priced restaurants which serve delicious food. The room was probably the smallest I have ever stayed in but I gather this is the norm for Rome and we both managed perfectly in it. We only used the room for sleeping and showering anyway. The shower was one of only two negatives about the hotel as the cubicle was very small. My partner and I are both slim and just about managed but we had to wonder how someone of a larger frame would manage. The Lirico serves a continental breakfast which had a good range of items; juice, hot drinks, cereals, yoghurt, rolls, cold meats. soft cheese, croissants, preserves, fruit and pastries (the ham is particularly tasty).The breakfast room brings me to the second of the two negatives - the tables are just close together for people to get in and out of without causing disruption to other guests if the breakfast room is full.. However this only happened one morning and the problem can be got around by getting down to breakfast before 8.30am. The hotel and the room itself was kept very clean and all the staff we encountered were polite and helpful. And yes, you will hear traffic noise but it's Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: LinM49552
Reviews.Content: Three couples stayed at this small hotel and we all agree that it was a pleasant experience. We needed transportation from the airport and back and it was all arranged by the staff at the hotel. We were very fourtunate to have someone like Tony help us with our plans, he also went out of his way to help us deal with a parking ticket. Location is near several major attractions, and for Rome I would agree with others that it is a great value for the money. We would highly recommend Hotel Lirico if stairs are not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel right in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: stumacd
Reviews.Content: What a lovely little hotel. We stayed for four nights and loved it. We were not sure when booking because of the italian star ratings but were pleasantly surprised on arrival. We booked direct with the hotel and got a cracking rate. There are around 20-25 stairs up to the hotel which older guests may find difficult. Our room was quite small but very clean and well looked after. The continental breakfast was very nice, a bit different to what I'm used to but a nice change. The staff were very helpful, they all seemed to have very good english. The staff at the front desk advised us on where to go, how to get there and the best restaurants. They also kept our bags for us on the last day so we could make the most of our time and not have to drag them around with us. My wife and I both loved our trip to Rome and would both highly recommend the Hotel Lirico. It is in a perfect location to easily get to all the major attractions and is great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, great locaion”
Reviews.Author: mbarnesny
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed at the Hotel Lirico for three nights in early September. The cost was reasonable for such a busy time of year, especially splitting it three ways. The staff at the hotel was friendly and helpful, even via email before we arrived. During our stay, Tony helped us with restaurant choices and directions and graciously split our bill three ways at checkout. Our room on the third floor was quiet and small (especially for three), but it did not matter as we only used it for sleeping. The hotel is a short walk from both Rome Termini and the Metro, which we used extensively. The only downside is the long flight of stairs that guests need to use getting up to reception, as carrying luggage up them is difficult. Aside from that, everything was wonderful. We will absolutely stay there again if we come back to Rome in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: Cdn77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of July for 4 days. We got a good rate even though it was during high season. I booked directly with the hotel. Before booking, I had a few questions and contacted them via email. They were prompt and friendly with their responses. I don’t recall what our room number was, but we were on the 3rd floor and overlooked the opera house. The view was quite nice. Our windows opened fully, which was nice to air out the room after our showers. The room was small, but average on Italy standards, but more importantly, was very clean and you can tell the place is well taken care of. The shower stall was very tiny, if you are a big person, it will be very tough. Ladies, there is zero room to reach down to shave your legs. The bed was firm but comfortable and on a solid frame – important if your partner is a tosser, like mine. The TVs have no English channels other than the BBC. I get that you’re not in Italy to watch TV, but we would have liked CNN or something to keep up with things at home, and when relaxing in our rooms, it would have been nice to have a channel to watch/listen to. The rooms are quite sound proof; we couldn’t hear people in the halls, in other rooms or anything outside. We slept no problem, which is crucial after long days of walking around Rome. The breakfast room is fairly small but their selection is quite good including hard-boiled eggs, yoghurt, cheese, ham, fruit, croissants, cereal and coffee/cappuccino/tea. The staff at the front desk are very helpful, speak English well and someone was always available to answer any questions and always seemed happy to do so. The rooms do not have alarm clocks – actually, none of the rooms we had across Italy and Greece had alarm clocks. All places did wake up calls though. The only time this was an issue was trying to read my watch in the dark room first thing in the mornings. No biggie. The elevator was small, but that seems to be standard in Europe. The hotel is about a 10-minute walk from Roma Termini. Pulling luggage across the cobblestone was a challenge. I printed off a Google map with directions so once we left the train station, I knew exactly where we were going. We took the Leonardo Express from Fumicino Airport. As other reviews say, the reception is up a flight of stairs – about 20 steps – so you must lift your luggage. Overall, we were both very pleased with this hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a central position with an excellent cost-benefit ratio. Full five tripadvisor stars!”
Reviews.Author: Sandgarnele
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Lirico for four days, and we can say: All the positive statements are correct, and also the 8 stars from HRS, where we booked the hotel. The position of the hotel is very central, so that you can reach most of the important museums or points of interests by foot or you can use the metro/bus. We thought that the position in the near of the railway station is a little bit critical, but the opposite is the case: a comparable quiet and secure street without any annoying things. We slept in a totally new and comfortable double bed (good for your back!), the room was very clean and the size of the room was totally ok. We know that there are smaller rooms, but we had luck. The staff was very friendly and helpful to find the good locations, ask Toni! You can see at the pictures that the hotel is in front of the Teatro dell' Opera, where you can buy tickets very easy. The rooms are very quiet and is it possible to sleep with open window. We were astonished because of the continental breakfast: boiled eggs, good cheese and raw / cooked ham, a lot of sweet things, and a good cappucino. Poeple from Austria, Switzerland and Germany will like it. For a restaurant go to strega, 50 m distance. The pizza and pasta is very good, the secondo is not the best. So, what are the bad things? For a 3 star hotel we can't report bad things. In general: If you are planniung a trip to Rome, please reserve the Vaticano Museum or the ancient Rome (e.g., by Roma pass) BEFORE your travel!

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and we would use this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: baileyl53
Reviews.Content: it was our first time in rome and we could not have picked a better hotel as it was central to everything. it was not that far from the train and bus station within walking distance. the hotel its self there was a porter there to take your suitcases up to your room and he show you how to use the room card. the towels were changed everyday and the beds maded aswell and the breakfast was good. we were able to walk to most of the attractions by using the map proved to us by the hotel. we did use the hop on the hop off bus for two days this is worth getting to see all the attractions. all in all we did have a good time and would go back when it is alot cooler and it was in the 90's when we went.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: magati
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights last week. Very clean, well appointed rooms. Standard size room for this style of European hotel. Small, but roomy enough. Good air conditioning (and my wife is an expert on this!). Beds are firn, but we found out from out other hotels that is the norm, it seems, in Italy. Staff is friendly, helpful and always available. Only a block off the busiest road in Rome, but not noisy at all. The breakfast was fine and more than met our needs to get our day going. We would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place! We recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: MtteForget
Reviews.Content: It's very clean, very well located (easy to walk to main monuments) in safe area, many restaurants around, staff is very very nice, breakfast is very good, English is spoken and a little French too. We, couple in our 50s recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fair price...Happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: nguyenator
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location was 15 minute walk from everything, the Collisium, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps. They had a great little free breakfast each morning that included a selection of coffees, deli meat, cheese, pastries, cereal, etc. Staff was very friendly and knew all of the bus routes to take (to Vatican City). Rooms were very clean and the AC worked excellent. All in all, after walking around Rome we think the location and price of this place was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “VERY helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: poggesi1961
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one night and we would stay there again the next time we're in Rome. The room was a nice size and clean. The bathroom was a little small but we've come to expect that from previous hotels. Badol was very gracious and helped us at the front desk with directions and suggestions on where to go and eat. Centrally located and close to Termini metro station.

Reviews.Title: “I would've tolerated the glitches but in the end - awful!”
Reviews.Author: Ozzy_trav
Reviews.Content: The location is fine - but so is just about anywhere in that central Rome area - heaps to see and do and manageable on foot or bus or metro. The sights are all about and spread out so each hotel will be closer to some things and further from others. Hotel Lirico ticked that box, but the rooms are tiny and bathrooms the size of cupboards. The internet drops out every time you leave your floor and you have to re-key in a lengthy user code and password. There was a bus strike and no one bothered to tell guests or put up a sign. Free breakfast was pretty ordionary - juice, a few rolls, a few croissants and cereal. There was a really aggressive and scary guy called Boldo (or something like that) who refused us internet use after we had checked out (wouldn't allow us late check out while my son was sick, ok, I understand they need the room!) but to refuse to allow us to sit in the lobby.or breakfast room and use the internet??? It's free in most coffee shops let alone accom that we've just had 2 rooms for 3 nights! He refused to give his name and then stood there screaming abuse and threats! A shame because Max and Tony were friendly and helpful, and Baldo soured the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location + Excellent Service = A Great Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: HappyPanda
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently as a group for some sightseeing before returning home to Australia and I am so glad we stayed here. It's ideally situated in the centre of town. Upon our arrival we were all given information and maps of the best places to eat and the locations of all the main tourist attractions thanks to Badol, the guy behind the desk at the time, he was extremely helpfull and friendly as was Tony the other manager who we also saw often during our stay. His recommendations for dinner and his advanced bookings were very helpful, especially in making sure the beer was on ice at the local we frequented often during our stay. The rooms were very clean, the bed and pillows were comfortable, the air conditioning worked perfectly, luckily as we arrived during a heat wave and the breakfast offered each morning was more than adequate and the coffee was excellent. I would highly recommend staying here and would certainly do so again if in Rome. AAA+++

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place”
Reviews.Author: Makinal
Reviews.Content: We spent our holiday between 04.07-08.07 in Hotel Lirico and everything was perfect for a 3 star hotel. You will love this hotel and will want to stay again . Yes there is a few steps in the enterance of the building but who cares , our room with a double bed was small but very clean. The Hotel is located near the opera building and there is a metro station , Also you can walk to anywhere from the hotel and come back at late , it is in a very safe area. Hotel staff are very friendly Mr. Antonio from reception gave us a city map , also he send us to a restaurant near the hotel and we had 2 glasses of red wine for free , but i do not recommend to eat there the service is terrible. There is a Carrefour express market next to the hotel and you can buy things cheaper. We loved this hotel and we will stay at this hotel for the next time.

Reviews.Title: “First stay, would return again"”
Reviews.Author: mkk_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one night and we would stay there again the next time we're in Rome. The room was a nice size and clean. The bathroom was a little small but we've come to expect that from previous hotels. Badol was very gracious and helped us at the front desk with directions and suggestions on where to go and eat. Centrally located and close to Termini metro station.

Reviews.Title: “VERY helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: totoo_11
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel nearby termini and opera. Rooms small but high ceiling. Free WiFi access that worked. Can total recommend staying there. Especially thanks to the staff who was extremely helpful even in uncommon situations. They promised to find a solution and they DID.

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT stay here again”
Reviews.Author: travelesque123
Reviews.Content: There are many other better choices out there. My advice is not to stay at Hotel Lirico. 1) Room was very claustrophobic and the decor is awful. 2) Shower is extremely small. (I'm not overweight, but if you are then forget it). 3) Cheap, rough sheets. Pillows extremely flat. 4) Must drag luggage up long flight of steep stairs. (Better be in good physical condition to stay here) 5) If you do decide to stay at this hotel be prepared to fork over extra cash at the end of your stay for additional "taxes" and fees. No, they won't take a credit card so you better have Euros. 6) Hotel breakfast is underwhelming and lacks variety. 7) Hotel staff is pushy with their "recommendations" for nearby restaurants in order to get their kickback, I suspect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: LynneMote
Reviews.Content: I have looked forward to coming to Rome for years and this hotel helped make it a fantastic trip. The location was perfect, you can easily reach most of the top 10 tourist sights from here on foot. Right next to the opera house we were able to hear some music being performed whilst outside which had a great atmosphere. We were lucky to be upgraded to a superior room, this was cool, clean and very comfortable. Lovely to get back to after a hot day in the sun. The receptionists were very helpful and friendly, Especially Badol who couldn't do enough for us! From booking resturant seats, taxis and giving us great tips, we looked forward to his smile every day. The breakfast room was small, but we got seated without waiting each morning, a continental style breakfast with lots of choice. I traveled with 3 other friends and we all agreed we would return to this hotel if we were in Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet, clean”
Reviews.Author: SWsupermom
Reviews.Content: We needed a room close to Termini, and this was an ideal spot just across from the Opera. Room was lovely, air conditioning worked great, desk staff was helpful. Would not work for mobility impaired as you have to climb a flight of stairs to get to reception. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly, I was disappointed by this hotel”
Reviews.Author: chickenbizkit
Reviews.Content: I agonized amongst Hotel Lirico, Hotel Selene, and Bettoja Hotel Nord Nuova Roma since they were all around the same price and close to Termini and Repubblica metro stops. I thought I'd made up my mind with the Bettoja, but at the last minute changed my mind to Hotel Lirico since I emailed them asking them to confirm wifi access and if they would be able to arrange a car for us as we had an early morning flight - both were confirmed. I am so bummed to be typing this, but I was just not pleased with this hotel. It may have something to do with me loving our hotel in Florence and setting an impossible standard for this hotel, BUT I don't think that's completely it. Yes, the location is great, the front desk staff is more than helpful, and almost everything was adequate, BUT the bathroom was just not up to par when it comes to cleanliness. I am by no means a high maintenance traveler, but I do expect a hotel to be somewhat clean! This hotel did not make that cut. In addition, travelers should be aware that you do have to hike up stairs just to get to the front desk, then climb a few more stairs to get to the lift. Not the end of the world for us since we're still spring chickens, but even my BF complained about having to carry suitcases up several flights of stairs just to get to a lift. I WAS aware of this ahead of time and thought it no big deal, but found it a bit annoying when I actually had to climb the stairs when we arrived and every day for the remainder of our stay. On top of that, I was more than miffed to learn that wifi is only available in the lobby - what's the point!?!?! We planned to use our iPhones to map out stops/trips for the day; find places to eat; search shops to visit; etc, but found it silly that we could not do so from our room. Also, irritated me even more when wifi access was the deciding factor in me choosing Lirico. The other hotels required that you pay for internet access. I do feel bad about not liking the hotel because the people were very nice and the car service they arranged actually arrived....and he arrived EARLY, but I just feel like the hotel needs a good cleaning and maybe should up the quality of their breakfast. Staff was very nice so the hotel gets three stars instead of two. I really wanted to like Hotel Lirico, but just ended up being very disappointed. I would not stay here again though it appears that other people seemed to enjoy their stay....wish I did too :(

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel close to Roma Termini”
Reviews.Author: MapleLeafsfanforever
Reviews.Content: This is a very very nice hotel. It is close to Roma Termini (about 10 min walk) The room we had is reasonable in size and very clean. The room also has a view to the Teatro dell'Opera di Roma, a nice view. There are tons of nice cafes and restaurants in nearby area. If you are looking at hotels near Termini, Hotel Lirico will be a good choice. The only down size about the hotel is that you will need to climb about 20 steps of stairs in order to get to the reception area of the hotel. We had 4 luggages, so you can imagine it was a tough climb

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: richnterry
Reviews.Content: This little hotel was just what we expected. Not very fancy and small but clean rooms. We arrived at the airport in Rome and took the train to Termini station which was just a short walk to the hotel. There are two metro stops close to the hotel - Termini and Repubblica which makes it fairly convenient getting around. All of the staff we encountered at the hotel were friendly and the young ladies that served at the continental breakfast were especially nice and we really liked the food, particularly the croissants and pastries very fresh and since we came right at the start they were warm. The steps leading up to the hotel lobby were a pain, but we don't have mobility issues so not that big a deal. We did think that charging 2.50 euro per day for the room safe was tacky. The wireless internet worked well except for one three hour period on the second day. We always had plenty of hot water in the shower and good water pressure. We had a nice view of the opera house and square next door.

Reviews.Title: “The Reviews are Accurate! Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: trmiller21
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the tripadvisor.com reviews on this hotel, we booked it for our 2 night stay in Rome despite the ugly photos. Yes the hotel is not the most modern, attractive hotel you will see when searching for hotels in Rome, but it is the best bargin by far. The hotel is within 2 blocks of the Termini station and 1-2 blocks from the metro station. It is within reasonable walking distance to the Trevi fountain as well, but it's faster to take the metro a few stops closer. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and spoke excellent English which I did not expect and came prepared with my little Italian knowledge. The rooms are huge for European standards. Our hotel room (311) overlooked the L'Opera and had such a pretty view. The room had a couch, table w. 2 chairs, queen size bed, 2 nightstands, etc.; you can see how big this is for Europe. The bed is not the most comfortable and quite hard, which I like, but be warned. The room is spotless along with the rest of the hotel. The price was amazing for the location and the quality of room. Breakfast was included in our price and was great; it's not a large English breakfast, but had a good choice of pastries, cereal, etc. more of an American Continental breakfast. I really can't find any flaws with this hotel other than the ugly decor, but really who cares about ugly wallpaper with such a great location at an affordable price. I highly recommend this hotel when in Rome. Also be sure to take the concierge recommendation and get your free welcome drink at Cafe Strega; the pizza is to die for and the wine by the glass is a huge goblet full portion and is only 4 euro; it was so good we ate there twice. It's right next to the hotel. There's also a Carefour next to the hotel if you need to stock up on toiletries or groceries.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, but . . .”
Reviews.Author: Muskellonge
Reviews.Content: After a long day of travel, and a 10-minute walk from our train we easily found the Lirico Hotel. It's in a busy section of Rome and you're close to bistros, cafes, museums, and the Metro. However . . . when you walk in the front door you are greeted with a long set of stairs leading to the front desk (which is on the 2nd floor). Ugh! No lift after a long day was uninspiring and if one was handicapped, no luck. Once we got to the lobby, we were greeted promptly and treated well the entire stay. There is a lift to take you to the rest of the floors, but is limited to only two passengers at a time. Our internet deal included complimentary drinks at a restaurant down the street (a flute of Prosecco). They have GREAT pizza and the deal of the day is to order wine by the glass at 3 euros each--they're huge! The morning breakfast was nice and well appointed (no hot foods such as eggs) and was altogether lovely. The Hotel is in the older style, which we liked with it's 12' ceilings and thick walls. It is well-maintained and appears in good shape. A couple of minor irritants: the beds are very firm (some might say like a rock), and the shower is small but new. We give the Lirico Hotel are hearty 3-1/2 thumbs up out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dollyCork_Ireland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend at the end of April/Start of May 2011. When we arrived our room wasn't ready but they kept our cases so we could go straight out into Rome. The hotel is within easy walking distance of all of Rome but the nearest attractions to the hotel were the Trevi fountain, the Spanish steps, the Pantheon and the Colosseum. The other side of the river is a slightly longer walk but on a beautiful day like we had, well worth it. We took the metro to the Vatican as we were short on time. The hotel staff were extremely helpful and gave us an invaluable map on arrival. They were willing to advise on good places to eat or drink, nothing was too much for them. Breakfast was ok, pretty much standard for Europe but nice to have it included and not have to go far for a morning coffee. The room was spotlessly clean and if i had to find a negative (it's hard with this hotel) i would say the rooms could do with a re-vamp. They are not modern. This as i said though is not a problem just if i had to find a negative. Personally aswell i think they need to put a mirror in the main room. With 2 girls in a room getting ready to go out, one mirror in the bathroom isn't enough. Overall i think this is a well run hotel in a fantastic location. there are numerous restaurants around the hotel. I would definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: whereissaz
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location fromm all public transport, including the metro, bus, termini and walking distance to all attrctions. the hotel staff were really polite and helpful and were always willing to help. they also spoke very good english. they even posted our postcards which arrived quicker than sending one in england. there was a wide variety of choice for breakfast and had great service. the rooms were of a decent size for what you need in a city break and was very peaceful. only one downfall was a toilet tht didnt flush, but other than that i would defiantely recomend this hotel to anyone!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad / Not good”
Reviews.Author: Ozan_Ist
Reviews.Content: bad Things: *Very small room *Lots of steps to go to hotel actually, Good things: *Very good location : close to main attractions and central train station *Friendly staff *Very clean

Reviews.Title: “Simply - amazing!”
Reviews.Author: WilliamArthur
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from Rome and are still marvelling over the Hotel Lirico. Central, close to the Metro and really friendly. I don't normally take much attention of restaurant recommendations but because we arrived late, took a chance and let the hotel make us a reservation. Just as promised, we ate in a family run restaurant close by and had no nasty surprises when the bill came!! Breakfast was good; plenty to feast on to keep you going for a busy day in Rome. The rooms were also what you would expect of a three star hotel, clean comfortable and well decorated. Overall, we had a very enjoyable stay in a really affordable hotel - we had booked well ahead and got a good rate. Thanks to Badol, the evening concierge who kept me up to date with the cricket scores and couldn't have been more helpful as we tried to find our way around the city!

Reviews.Title: “clean ,quite ,well positioned”
Reviews.Author: hughandjulie
Reviews.Content: First time to Rome we had read the reviews and picked this hotel.It meet everything we wanted great position we were able to walk everywhere most places only short distances.Metro and buses close by. hotel spotless our room was on the small side but very clean with good shower room towels changed everyday,breakfast enough choice and enough room to sit and eat it. staff helpful if we went back to Rome would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: alexbailo
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in February. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, providing us with a map of the main sights and recommending restaurants etc. The room was fairly large in size and very clean. Also, there was a good varied selection on offer for breakfast. The Lirico Hotel was in an ideal place; a 2minute walk from the Termini and short walk from the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. Overall, I couldn't find a fault with this hotel. Location is perfect and it is very good value for money. Wouldn't think of staying anywhere else now. I'd highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: paulj79
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend visited this hotel in march 2010, Reception staff are very friendly and welcoming. The rooms are abit on the small side to what we expected but were very clean and comfortable. would reconmend hotels airport transfer as not badly priced,plus drivers dont driver crazy like normal taxis. hotel breakfast was plentyfull with a selection for everybody, best thing toeat lots as there is plenty to see round the city. we got are self a map free from the hotel and used it to are full advantage, would suggest walking arond if possiable as there aremany surprises in the city. we found areself going to an iish bar around the coner from the hotel most nights as very big with friendly people and good value. we took around 600euros for the 5 days and found it was about right fo eating lunch and dinner, sightseeing and entertainment. i would reconment this hotel as it is in walking distance of most historical sites. we both hope to return to rm soon and are certainly going to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: orduck01
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lirico was in a good location - within blocks of the main train station in Rome. Upon arrival the gentleman (I assumed was the manager) welcomed us and recommended a restaurant for dinner (he gave us a coupon for a free drink). The room was updated, although cramped. We couldn't get the satellite to work during our stay and were repeatedly told it was under repair. It wasn't that big of deal because we weren't in the room very often, but when we were it was frustrating. They had free wi-fi for guests and a password was provided, however, it kicked us off repeatedly every 5 minutes or so - even while actively online. We had made reservations online for Ancient Rome & the Vatican and when we checked-in I asked if we could print the email confirmations. The first person said that would be no problem and at all and gave me an email address to forward everything too. When we came back down after getting settled in our room, there was someone different at the desk and this person was not very friendly. I felt like our request to print a few emails was a huge inconvenience for him & he wanted to charge us for the prints, which the first guy said nothing about. Breakfast was included in our room rate and included pastries, eggs, meat, cheese, bread, milk, juice & hot drinks. The breakfast room got pretty busy and when food was gone, it was not replenished very fast. Overall, the rooms were nice and the location was good.

Reviews.Title: “VALUE FOR MONEY- VERY CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: ZIOGreece
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel , very close to termini, bus, metro, all attractions in a walking distance. Great breakfast and perfecdt capuccino, very polite staff. Worth your money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money, Best Location for Touristic Stay”
Reviews.Author: h_from_btown
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights and was more than happy with this hotel. Although the price is relatively lower in Rome, the quality was very good! Pros: very friendly staff, good continental breakfast (with great coffee of course), room service, luggage storage possible, fantastic location for all touristic sites, staff reacted very well on requests, nice classical decorated rooms. Cons (if I have to name them): there is one flight of stair to enter the hotel, so beware for those with mobility problems, after that there is an elevator to the rooms. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Comfortable in Roma”
Reviews.Author: creativecatz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in early November for three nights with our teenage daughter. It is an easy walk from the Roma Termini train station, however ask for directions as roads not easily marked. Easy walk to sites, metro stop and shopping district. We booked a triple room at 95.68 Euro per night via the internet. Our room had one queen size and one single sofa/bed (not fold out). The room was beautifully decorated but small. The bathroom was nicely appointed and clean. Included in the price was buffet breakfast (coffee prepared as you like it), however the breakfast room is very small and busy (we only had breakfast once at the hotel – found it elsewhere in a more relaxed environment after the first mornings experience). There is free wi-fi. Thank you to the reception staff who made us feel very welcome and were happy to chat and advise us on local restaurants, sites to see and our airport transfer (very nice limo service). The only drawbacks for this hotel is that reception is on the first floor and there is no lift to this level (lift from reception to your room – although it broke down one day of our stay). Also the walls are very thin – we could actually hear the guests in the next room, we actually had to yell out to ask them to be quiet so we could sleep in the middle of the night. This occurred only on one night. The hotel was comfortable and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE IN LIRICO HOTEL!”
Reviews.Content: Good & convenient location, nice & helpful staff, clean & cozy room, rich & healthy breakfast, considerate & excellent. One little tiny shortcoming is the WIFI is not that stable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful breakfast to start the day with ...”
Reviews.Author: mlimk
Reviews.Content: Hotel is easy to locate, It is near the Rome Termini station and there are lots of places you can go for your meals. I like the breakfast that is provided, simple and yet sufficient to start your day right. Room is nice and clean and my wife and I enjoy the peaceful atmosphere. We spent our last 2 nights in Rome at this hotel and it was easy to make our way to the airport via the Termini station from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ujay1
Reviews.Content: Idealy situated, very helpful staff on receiption spotlesly clean and comfortable rooms and a very good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly & very helpful”
Reviews.Author: Oberon12
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lirico is an unpretentious establishment, but is clean, friendly and hepful. We were able to book in early without any problem. The breakfast was excellent, and the coffee superb. What's more, the hotel is barely 30 metres from the Opera House. Any gripes? Well, I suppose a larger bath would have been good, but how long do you spend in the bath?

Reviews.Title: “The Lirico is a very clean and...”
Reviews.Author: Gillibrand65
Reviews.Content: The Lirico is a very clean and comfortable hotel, situated close to the Plaza de Republic and The main terminal. It's a three star hotel, so you do not get luxury but you do get excellent service and staff who are very helpful. Tony have us excellent recommendations where to eat, so ask Tony and you will not be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel but there is probably a better one out there.”
Reviews.Author: HelenB39
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Very small room (302) but we managed ok as there's a good wardrobe. Shower cubicle very small and not very good water pressure. There are a lot of steps up to the front door of the hotel which might be a problem for some. Breakfast was average but adequate and the only lift is small, sometimes you have to wait a while to use it and there isn't an option to use stairs. The staff were friendly and helpful and overall the hotel is well located and clean. I would use it again and would recommend it, but not if I took anyone elderly because of the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: HunB
Reviews.Content: Lirico is a good hotel, I recommend for everyone. The room was very little, the breakfast was good and fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: andrew_house
Reviews.Content: We found the Lirico a friendly and convenient place to stay. The breakfast is superb, the staff really helpful and friendly, our room although compact was immaculate and had air con. Although the hotel is only a few hundred yards from the main train station, if you arrive from the airport on the leonardo express, the platforms you arrive at are at the far end of the station, so the walk is nearly twice a long, but only around 15 minutes in total.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel met all our needs.”
Reviews.Author: ValThomas
Reviews.Content: In a good, quiet location the Lirico is a small hotel which manages to combine an intimate atmoshere with a respect for residents' privacy. The rooms are quite small but adequate and the standard of cleanliness is excellent. The staff are friendly & very helpful. There are several city tours on offer but the cheapest way to see the city by bus is to take a local bus with a 4 euro day ticket. Take identification at all times as there are admission offers available. E.g. If you are over 65 years of age, some venues are free, e.g. forum/colosseum.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice and Clean. Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Drapier66
Reviews.Content: This is not a four star experience but it is a great hotel for the price. I found all the staff to be very frietndly and helpful. I used this hotel to bookend my stay in Italy and was able to check in early on both occasions. I have to say anyone with mobility issues should not stay here as the stairway would create a challenge. After a day of walkng in Rome I came to dread it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel- friendly staff, great breakfast and a great location for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: Caroline_223
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Hotel Lirico for four nights at the end of August and had a great stay, the hotel was exactly what we were looking for. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from Roma Termini, which was ideal for us as we came from the station and had big bags, and didn't fancy lugging them very far in the heat of Rome. The hotel was in a great location for exploring Rome, it was reasonably close to everything (considering the size of Rome) and we felt safe in the area (it is next to an opera theatre and is just off Via Nazionale, one of the main roads in Rome). The staff were friendly, helpful and spoke excellent English. The room was spacious and ensuite with a comfortable bed, sofa and air conditioning. I would recommend bringing ear plugs with you though- there was no noise from outside, but the interior walls were thin, which wasn't ideal when the man in the next room started playing opera music at 11pm. However, we found that all the hotels we stayed at in Italy had similar noise levels so I wouldn't let it put you off (as long as you have earplugs- we slept fine with them). The breakfast we had was the best we had in a hotel during our trip- cereal, rolls, toast, jams, ham, cheese, croissants, fruit, cake, pastries, biscuits and even (hot!) boiled eggs. We paid in cash, so received a discount- it worked out at 78 euros a night, which we thought was reasonable, and were pleased with. We would definitely recommend Hotel Lirico, and have recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Close and Pleasant!”
Reviews.Author: frags1064
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for any inner Rome needs. We walked everywhere from the Liricao.......ATM around the corner, We found some great places to buy focacia's and the like if we didn't eat out. Rooms weren't huge but definately adequate for a short stay. Very clean which is the most important part and I could not fault the staff. They were all pleasant and always smiling. Breakfast was good and the staff always available there if you needed anything. Overall I would say we had a very pleasant stay and if in Rome again I would stay at the Lirico for sure....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service from Staff in Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laura4Chris
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 16 Aug for a week in Lirico Hotel. Location is excellent, just a few minutes walk from the Termini Station, we came back about 11pm on a train one night and according to other reviews the termini area can be a bit rough but we did not experience this, i think if you stay to the main roads you are fine. Rooms are comfortable and clean (cleaned and beds made, new towels every day) also we asked for an extra pillow and was brought to us as requested. Bathroom size ok, Shower was good although slightly squashed! Breakfast was continental, it was good. All staff were excellent and a few mornings we had to leave before breakfast started (7:30-10:00) and we asked at reception the day before if we could get something prepared to take away and they said yes. The next day we went down and reception did remember and asked the kitchen staff and they kindly prepared some fresh, hot croissants for us to take away. Check out time is 11am but our flight was not until late at night, we asked if we could have a late checkout, hotel kindly accommodated us at the price of 50Euro, but was well worth it as Rome was 30degrees the whole trip and a shower was greatly needed later in the day before flying home! The hotel and the hotel staff were excellent and would definitely stay here again! And last but not least, Rome was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: BluebelleLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated next to the Opera House and is within walking distance of the train station and many sites. We stayed in a triple room which was perfect - clean, comfortable and no disturbance from either inside or outside the hotel. The only down side is that the lighting could have been a little stronger. Breakfast was fine - not terribly exciting but that is a minor detail. The staff are friendly and helpful and will always make suggestions if you are looking for a restaurant etc. We spent three days at this hotel and would definitely recommend it/go back. The only thing to be aware of is that less-abled people will find it a struggle to walk up a flight of stairs with luggage in order to get into the hotel reception. Unfortunately there is no lift.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, OK rooms, location could be better”
Reviews.Author: pickytraveler515
Reviews.Content: The staff was wonderful and helpful. The airport shuttle was very convenient, but I was quoted a different price when I set up the return to the airport than Iwhat paid for being picked up. We stayed in a triple room which was tight but it worked. The shower head faces out into the shower curtain/bathroom so you have to hold it at all times to avoid flooding the bathroom/room. The bathroom is very small. The hotel is close to the train termini station which can be good during the day, but the area around the termini isn't so great at night. The hotel is far enough away from the termini that the area is safe at night, but it is also at least a 15-20 minute walk from the nearest major tourist attraction (Colosseum) so you'll have a long walk back to the hotel at night to avoid the dangerous termini area. The metro in Rome offers limited convenience, so I'd recommend staying in a hotel closer to the attractions or metro stations other than the termini. Overall, though, Hotel Lirico is reasonably priced and in a decent area. With everything so expensive in Rome, I would definitely stay there again because of the value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Lirico.....I would...”
Reviews.Author: niget1957
Reviews.Content: My wife and have just returned from a five night stay in Rome (July 24 - 29). If you are after Five star luxury, go somewhere else. If you want clean air conditioned rooms, friendly helpful staff, central location, reasonable price.... then this is the place for you. The room was a good size, nicely decorated. The shower was a bit small, but so what. Good choice of breakfast food. For heavens sake you are in Rome, You are only going to be sleeping and freshening up here. Seriously consider this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spirit59
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel 10 minutes from Termini Station and very near to the central sights. We only stayed one night but found the staff very friendly with a special mention for Tony at reception - a great person who will give you excellent advice for your visit. The rooms were clean and a reasonable size. Our daughter slept on the bed/settee and found it very comfortable. Overall a good hotel with an excellent location. I would reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Dolcevita05
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed in the Hotel Lirico for 4 nights in June. Our room was small but air conditioned, nicely decorated and very clean. The location was excellent, walking distance to most attractions and also close to the public transportation – Termini Station is just up the street. The staff was very friendly and helpful – thank you Tony. The wireless in the room was free. Breakfast was excellent and plenty of it – the coffee was awesome I wish I asked about the brand. The service was quick and efficient. We had a very enjoyable stay and I would recommend the hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough...”
Reviews.Author: wishyouwerefloyd
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good enough, good budget hotel... free wifi, breakfast and walking distance from the nearest metro, some 10 minutes walk. Also nearby churches which i think is present in every block in Rome. Lots of restaurants and a few boutiques are just a few minutes walk away. The only problem was that the hotel didn't have an elevator from the street entrance to the reception which is i think 2 floors up. Had to carry my kid's stroller up and down as they don't have any locker or anything downstairs. Has a liquor shop and an ice cream joint just outside which was a plus. Had a good work out with the stairs so i rewarded myself daily with booze and gelato.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Kona52
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the Lirico on June 5th/6th 2010 and found it to be a good value for the money. Plan to pay your bill in cash to avoid any surcharge for credit card use. The free breakfast is very good and the front desk staff speak English well. Tony was especially helpful in pointing out a place to eat. Location of the hotel is within walking distance of the stazione termini even if you are backpacking or rolling luggage. The one negative is the free internet service which did not work in our room and only barely in the hotel reception area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and very friendly reception staff”
Reviews.Author: VandMabroad
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Lirico for 4 nights in mid June. The hotel was very nicely decorated and the staff, particularly Tony on reception were very helpful. Breakfast was adequate and plenty of it. A very enjoyable stay and would definetely recommend to friends and family. Hopefully when we return to Rome in the future we will stay here again. The only thing I didn't realise (didn't read the small print properly) was that there was a 10% charge for payment using a card - my mistake but just wanted to make others aware.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service at a 3 star price- a little gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jandaonvacation
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the outstanding service of this hotel from the minute we arrived. Typically hot day in Rome and this was a cool, comfortable little paradise. Our bags were delivered to our room, dinner reservations made and a laptop set up within minutes of our arrival and it just got better from there. Our room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. Breakfast was typical of Italy, but again the service was quick and friendly. Tony at the front desk was a great guide for local restaurants and directions. This was the cheapest hotel of a three week tour, but by far the nicest stay.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Holiday”
Reviews.Author: t133673
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very accommodating nothing was too much trouble. The room was very clean, welcoming and looked onto the Opera House. Located very close to the main train station and handy for all travel. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deborah36
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel in May this year, its only a five minute walk from the Termini, location is excellent for all tourist sites, in fact its right next door to the opera theatre. On first impressions of the outside of the building I will be honest and thought "Oh dear" as its in need of a coat of paint, but on walking through the door, what a surprise, clean, friendly and welcoming. The rooms are lovely and clean and certainly nice to return to after a days walking in Rome. Very substantial breakfast with lots to chose from which is constantly being refreshed. It was a busy hotel but most importantly We would definitely stay there again and recommend to visitors to the beautiful city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: visitor034
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for 4 nights. We found the hotel to be very nice with freindly staff and large/clean rooms. The hotel benefits from being 5 min walk from the main Termini station and the metro which made visiting any attractions in Rome very quick and easy. There were plenty of restaurants and cafes to visit within very short walking distance. What a great city to visit. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tight squeeze in Rome”
Reviews.Author: farthews
Reviews.Content: After quite a long walk from the Termini Rail Station(we took the wrong exit from the platform and had to take our luggage up a very long hill!) we eventually found the Lirico.We ran the bell for porter assistance as there was no way we would have made it up the flight of stairs with our cases.Tony was on the desk and was most charming with his welcome and offered advice on restaurants.Our room was on the 3rd floor so we used the lift,on opening the door to our room we were very disappointed.It was very cramped,but very clean.I went back to the reception to ask for a bigger room but was told that the hotel was fully booked.We chose to dine at The Roof Garden, as recommended by Tony,on our first evening.The food was good but the meal was quite expensive.We found many choices for dining within a few minutes walk from the hotel,one of our favourites being The Alessio on via del viminale (just higher up the road on the opposite side to the Lirico) We had an extentended stay in Rome due to the volcanic ash,but as the Lirico was full they recommended The Corona on via Napoli.You will find our review of this hotel on Tripadvisor under Hotel Corona.

Reviews.Title: “good friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: crouchies
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights over Easter with our teenage children and it was perfect for us all. It was convenient for all the sightseeing both walking and on the buses. The Colosseum and Roman Forum was a particular favourite for us all and only 10 minutes away. Tony on reception was fantastic and a real treasure, we didn't mind him recommending the restuarants, Il Barocco was a friendly good value restaurant, with free starters and drinks thrown in on our second visit. The hotel rooms were clean and adequate although a little smaller than we are used to but that was not a problem, there is too much to do in Rome to stay in them for anything other than sleeping. We would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “be careful”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireOscar
Reviews.Content: Hotel very good, clean and centrally located. Be careful about Tony and any recommendations regarding restaurants. We went to the "roof garden" up the road and were overcharged. Service was added and the price on menu increased on bill. Do not assume the bill is correct. Tony must be getting a back-hander.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable hotel with friendly staff and conviently placed.”
Reviews.Author: ArchersSalisbury
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Lirico to be comfortable and clean with friendly staff and very conveniently placed for the main Termini and metro, next to the Opera House. Tony was very helpful with suggestions for restaurants etc, nothing seemed too much trouble for him even down to getting us a taxi within 4 minutes when our pre-arranged one didn't turn up to take us back to the airport. We would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to spend a few nights in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Palinka_R
Reviews.Content: I don’t like the hotel. Rooms are tiny and gloomy. They have decorated the walls with dark blue wallpapers, together with heavy dark curtains and small room dimensions the place really depresses you. But it’s OK if you are going only to sleep there…. The most unpleasant thing was that the hotel staff has blocked on my credit card the WHOLE sum for the 1st night stay the day before arriving. Usually hotels block small sum to be sure the credit card is real but nobody has never block such a big sum in advance. When we paid for the stay they nevertheless made us to pay the same sum again, telling the blocked sum will be unblocked in the nearest future. The boy at the reception explained us the hotel don't believe their clients and usually blocks the sum for the 1st night stay at everybody's client card in case they won’t come.

Reviews.Title: “A fair and confortable stay near the Termini station, Rome.”
Reviews.Author: limoca
Reviews.Content: The reception of this hotel is located on the 1st floor, only accessible by a straight stairway. The rooms are accessible by an elevator, from the reception. For people with heavy luggage, elderly and reduced mobility people the access is not very easy. The breakfast is fair and tasty, and the coffee is very, very good, (rates one of the best I had in Rome), directly served from an express coffee machine. Nice counter for people that only have time for a quick coffee and do not wish to seat. Internet available for free, it will refresh every 10min but it is fast and free.

Reviews.Title: “good, not great”
Reviews.Author: vrmtldy
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel because of the reviews, but they were not a good representation. although the hotel has an excellent location, close walk to metro, buses, and short walk to major sites, the staff was pretty much useless. they only recommended restaurants where they would get a "kick back", same with the taxi service. when asked to help look up something, they said they could not do anything without us first providing the phone number! There was a $3 euro/day charge just to use the in-room safe (which all we needed was the key to open it, it was already there!) The continental breakfast was marginal, although a delicious cappucino was served. If you wanted tea or coffee any other time, you have to pay $2 euro. No amenities in the room. Hotel was clean, bed hard, large towels in the bathroom. One plus was the room we had (#206) on the second floor had a magnificent window overlooking the Opera House. One note, if you want a wake up call, the phones do not work. First wake up call we requested at 8:00AM was met with a knock on the door, but the second call we requested at 6:15AM in order to catch a taxi to the airport never materialized. SET YOUR ALARM ON YOUR CELL PHONE FOR BACK UP!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NicolaCV
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a 2 night stay at Hotel Lirico. Stayed in a triple room 216 and was pleasantly suprised at just how lovely the rooms were decorated and had expected the rooms to be similar to what you would get in Paris and the bathroom was a lot larger than expected. Breakfast consisted of cereal, bread rolls, croisants, ham, cheese and eggs and various other things. I would recommend a cafe latte, they are lovely. If you fancy a nice pizza for lunch, try Crazy Pizza down Via Torino, very reasonable and the best we had in Rome! Coloseum is about a 15 minute stroll from the hotel and we also used the Metro to go to the Vatican (4 euro for a day ticket) make sure you go early to beat the crowds, you can also get the 64 and 40 bus but do be aware of pick pockets, Tony at the hotel also warned us of it. The area around the hotel is safe and also has some nice restaurants and a supermarket across the road. Also, hotel is a 5 minute walk to the train station. Trains from the airport are 11 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: georgeerosado
Reviews.Content: This is my second trip to Italy. I absolutely love Italy and just want to make that very Clear! I think that I am most critical because of my high expectations of service and friendliness! I was NOT dissapointed with HOTEL LIRICO! First of all, It is in an EXCELLENT LOCATION! It is close to everything, walking distance from all the main attractions, the COLISEUM, the Fontana Trevi, The Spanish Steps, shopping and great restaurants. Its only a few minutes walking distance from Termini Station. The hotel was IMMACULATE, I was extremely impressed with how clean the hotel is. It smells clean, it feels clean, it is clean !!! That is extremely important to me. Safety is also a very mayor factor for me. The security measures were very appropiate! My room was very comfortable and cozy! But, what I must compliment this hotel is on the E X C E L L E N T customer service. AMAZING! Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful! ESPECIALLY TONY at the front DESK! My sister and I are sooooo grateful to him in sooooo many ways! He was a total gentlemen and helped us out with great restaurants, suggestions on shopping areas, and suggested places to visit, etc! I will absolutely recommend this hotel for your Rome vacation...........and should I visit Rome again in the near future I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cgerm40
Reviews.Content: Small, boutique hotel in historic building. Clean, cozy within walking distance of everything you need to see in Rome. Close to bus and train station. I am very picky about hotels and cleanliness, felt very comfortable here.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: jovidaha
Reviews.Content: Two couples stayed 3 nights to cover the rugby 6 Nations match. The hotel is a short walk from the station and, even with luggage, not a problem. So getting to and from the airport is easy. The hotel is decorated to a high standard and the rooms are clean, compact and well appointed. The bathrooms are spotless and minute! Anyone above average size does well to get in and out of the shower, but the water is hot and plentiful. This hotel is not suitable for the elderly or infirm as there is a significant flight of stairs to get to the lobby entrance. Continental breakfast was better than many I've experienced, the bar was OK for a quick drink or to take back to the room and all the staff were friendly and helpful. Perfect for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Grazie Lirico!”
Reviews.Author: GJSD
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lirico is a great choice to lodge in Roma; it is clean, well located, offers good breakfast and its entire staff is courteous, attentive and helpful (Massimo and Tony are great recommending dinnig and sightseeing options as well as explaining directions). In my case, Hotel Lirico contributed to a memorable visit to Roma and I would certainly stay here again! G.Sangiovanni, Dom.Rep.

Reviews.Title: “I would like stay here again”
Reviews.Author: bodiller
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel mainly because it is about a five minute walk from the Termini train station – that they serve breakfast and the reviews. Everything we wanted to see was in walking distance. My daughter and I felt comfortable and safe in this neighbourhood. Tre room was small but clean. The staff were very friendly and did speak english.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service, Awesome Room, Amazing Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelorDie05
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for us from the start!!
