We got in really early from a cruise and they were very willing to hold on to our bags while we went out and started seeing the city and the room was getting ready. They were very open with giving us great advice on where to eat, with one exception...There was a restaurant that we ate at that was on a roof top and the food was only ok, but they charged us for everything even the stuff that they brought us as samples. It was a average meal that cost us about 80 euro. Other than that they gave us great directions and advice. As far as the hotel the rooms where much larger that what was expected for most rooms in europe. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was very nice. The wireless was free, but we needed to sit by the door to get any signal, but that was ok it was free. The breakfast was pretty good, they had bread, croissants, meats, juice and coffee (witch was awesome, if you like good dark coffee). It was an easy walk to all locations except for the vatican, but it was only a short train ride. The only problem with this hotel is that you have to go up a level of stairs to get to the main desk. I WILL stay here next time that I am in Rome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Lirico Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KRFarrell
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lirico was in a great location next to the Opera House. The hotel was on a block of its own and in a quiet, clean and safe area close to transportation and walking distance to many local sites. The hotel was spotless and the staff was helpful and friendly. Breakfast was good and the coffee they served was the best we had in Italy. I would return to this hotel and have already recommended it to friends planning trips to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: bizkette00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 5 nights. It was cheap (about 75 Euro a night), quiet, conviently located ( about 3 blocks away from the main train/bus station, right next to two metro stations *subway*). The room was a decent size and clean. They served a good breakfast that lasted till around 10:30. There was an Irish bar down the block that served suprisingly good food and drinks, we found ourselves there a few nights. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel at a fabulous price!”
Reviews.Author: Garnet_Stone
Reviews.Content: Booked 9 nights at Hotel Lirico and could not be any more pleased with my stay. As a solo female traveller, I wanted a clean, comfortable hotel in a safe location, with good transportation links AND at an affordable rate. Lirico exceeded my expectations on all fronts. From the moment I arrived I was greeted with a warm welcome and a smile by Tony at reception. This treatment continued throughout my entire stay. Every interaction with the staff (reception, housekeeping, breakfast crew, night desk) was consistently courteous and helpful. My “double for single use” room was spotless and well laid-out with ample storage in the oversized closet. The firm mattress was perfect after a long day of touring the sites. The bathroom was modern, gleaming white and well stocked with soaps, shower caps, sewing kit, etc. The shower stall was a little tight but I managed very well. Breakfast buffet was delicious and offered a nice variety of options (yogourt, cheese, meat, fresh croissants, rolls, spreads, cereal, fruit juices, cappuccino yum!). Location/Transportation: 5-7 minute walk from Termini station – extremely handy if you plan on taking the Leonardo Express from/to the airport or have daytrips to Florence/Venice etc. 3-4 minute walk to Repubblica Metro station. Constant stream of buses to the historic centre (#s 40, 64, 70, H) just 1 block away on Via Nazionale. I never had any concerns about walking back to the hotel at 11:30pm from the metro/bus stop since there were always people/couples/families walking about. I highly recommend this hotel and wouid not hesitate to book Lirico for my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A very clean and charming hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ShirleyCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We loved this charming hotel, just a short 10 minute walk from the Termini Train Station. The office staff who spoke very good English were all very friendly and helpful. They were always willing to give us the information we needed. Our hotel room was small but sparkling clean, beautifully decorated, and quiet. The shower was very small, but worked for us. Perhaps there are rooms with larger shower/tubs, if needed. The complimentary breakfast buffet was very good, and we loved the friendly food service staff. We would definitely stay here again if we returned back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “clean comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: druimbuidhe
Reviews.Content: Comfortable friendly hotel. Close to many attractions and short walk from station termini. Reception staff always willing to answer questions and offer advice. Ask for cappucino at breakfast if you enjoy good coffee. Hotel organised taxi to fuimicino airport for set price of 50 euros, may cost more on Sundays. Happy to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly hotel, good location, would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: DaisyMax1970
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here. The rooms and bathrooms are very clean and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful and speak fantastic English! The hotel is in a great location, only a ten minute walk from the Colosseum and near lots of pizzerias and bars. There is a Metro station a few minutes walk up the road from which you can access all parts of the city. They serve a continental breakfast including cereal (cornflakes & coco pops) and you can have as much as you like. I would definitely recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “great location great price”
Reviews.Author: btatravel
Reviews.Content: We travelled thru Europe this summer and booked alot of hotels thru trip advisor. Everything went very well. We were on the train and chose hotels near train stations. The Lirico was easy to find and everything we needed. Easy to get around Rome and the front desk always had someone on with advice, answers and tips. A great breakfast to start the day and safe area for our luggage on our last day as we had a morning tour and did not get back to hotel til mid afternoon. The smallest fo any rooms we stayed at, but still comfy for 3 people and very clean. We are defenitely going back to Rome for a longer stay(only 3 nights this time) and will look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ZOE044
Reviews.Content: I went with my husband for his 40th birthday. The Lirico is a neat hotel run by 3 brothers, the staff are lovely and will help in anyway they can, offering advise on how to travel around and where to eat etc. The rooms are clean and comfortable. It's a ten minute walk from the train station and a 5 minute walk from the metro, which is only 1 euro wether you travel one stop or 10 stops. The restuarants nearby are reasonable, not as expensive as right in the centre. I would definately stay here again if I ever go back to Rome. Mark and Zo

Reviews.Title: “4 nights in Rome.... great room”
Reviews.Author: mapleleaf_trvlr
Reviews.Content: comfortable rooms - clean, small bathtub, comfortable bed (firm), satellite TV (took some tweaking to get satellite channels to work initially), quiet, lift does not go to the street level so be prepared to haul your luggage up a long flight of stairs, good breakfast (boiled eggs, meats, yogurt, cheese, buns, pastries, fresh fruit, juices), free wifi, fee for the safe, air conditioning quickly cooled the room. Didn't find any mosquitoes outside, but there were several in the room. helpful and friendly desk staff - made restaurant recommendations but there are several great restaurants in the area, made tour reservations and inquiries on our behalf. There are cheaper tour (hop on, hop off) operators than the company the hotel was promoting.

Reviews.Title: “Simply great!”
Reviews.Author: GillesB7
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in Hotel Lirico and are very satisfied. Friendly staff, clean rooms and a good breakfast. The location near the Termini is also good for people arriving by train. We enjoyed our stay very much and will surely book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Nicholson
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, particularly if you are traveling to or from Rome by train. The hotel staff were very welcoming and the reception staff excellent . The single rooms in particular are of a good standard and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel We've Stayed at in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jmdOhio
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located close to Roma Termini, next to the Opera House. I would suggest buying a map of Rome (with landmarks) to get around prior to arrival as Rome can be hard to navigate, and streetnames aren't always obvious. There are a couple flights stairs you must climb prior to reaching reception and the elevator, so be aware if packing heavily. Once there, we were greeted by Tony, who was more than helpful. He suggested authentic restaurants (which were fabulous), and he was great to talk to. The rooms were very clean and were a decent size compared to some Italian hotels. Wireless internet was free of charge. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: socridielu
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good position. The room was nice, very clean and silent. Wide bathroom clean too. Staff very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: NinaStockholm
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days at the Lirico hotel in Rome together with my husband and we where really pleased with the hotel. The rooms are clean and nice and the staff is fantastic. The reception is open 24 hours and can always give you advice on good restaurants and things to do. They even helped us to arrange reservations for table etc. Location is perfect close to the opera and you can walk almost anywhere. Breakfast buffé was good with sereal, youghurt and different kinds of bread and fruit. Perfectly normal for a hotel of this class. We will deffenately go back there with our kids the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Short stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LincolnWeekender
Reviews.Content: Having done my research before booking, i got more than I was expecting. Very friendly staff, more than adequate choices at breakfast. Ideally situated for all the major sights. Great base for sightseeing. Small compact rooms, but excellent standard of decor. I WILL definitely use again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for 1st time Rome visitors”
Reviews.Author: tourismo3
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. We chose it based solely on trip advisor reviews, price and location. The staff was helpful. Rooms clean and quiet. Breakfast was good and convienent. Good access to the Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could want at a great price”
Reviews.Author: thepianoman
Reviews.Content: The thing that really stuck out about this place was the really friendly service from all the staff (even the night staff). Breakfast too was good, with good quality food. Everything really clean too. Will definitely be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Potteriesgirl
Reviews.Content: A great Hotel about 10-15 minute walk from Termini railway station. We found the staff friendly and efficient; the rooms were very clean and air conditioned, which was a nice surprise as that did not appear in the details we were given. A great central location, we were able to walk to the Trevi fountain (and back!), walked to Termini to take the Metro to the Spanish Steps and the Colesseum, walked to Termini to take an open-topped bus tour. In all, were there for 4 nights and were delighted with the Hotel and it's location. Breakfast was the usual: bread, meat, cheese, croissant, fruit etc but plentiful and fresh. No facility for lunch or dinner, but Via Viminale is well provided with cafe's and restaurants. There is also a small supermarket just opposite the Hotel that we used to buy makings for lunch. Best things about the Hotel are the staff and it's location, worst is the flight of stairs needed to get into the Hotel; for me, this makes it a great Hotel rather than fantastic one. If there is any way to get the lift to street level you should do it.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: EmiW
Reviews.Content: We got to this hotel while reading reviews on the web and it was just as good as described! Staff is really nice, everything is clean, rooms are big, breakfast was great and it's really close to everything. Next time in Rome we will surely stay in this hotel! Highly highly recommanded!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect base for a short break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: markbeags
Reviews.Content: Situated next to the Opera, the hotel is just a short walk from Termini station and main metro/bus routes. You will be greeted warmly by Toni and the other staff - all friendly and polite. Rooms are a bit 'compact & bijou' but spotlessly clean and beautifully decorated, with a safe (€2.50 per day), aircon and ensuite shower/WC. Rooms are cleaned daily, with crisp cotton sheets and a lovely firm bed too!!!! Buffet style continental breakfast is simple and adequate, with fresh fruit and rolls, and the breakfast area is kept stocked & tidy by the pleasant staff. The hotel is convenient for all the main tourist attractions - Colosseum or Trevi Fountain are a 20 mins walk, or a 24hr bus/metro pass will cost just €4, useful for when the feet begin to ache! We opted for guided tours at the Colosseum & Palatine (€22), Vatican (€45) and Renaissance Rome (€45 including a meal) - not cheap, but you jump all the queues and get to see so much more of the essential historical facts & places. Just make sure you get an official tourist guide. To summarise: this is a great value hotel at under €100 per night, and the staff are all helpful and pleasant. We would be delighted to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Great Standard”
Reviews.Author: LMJ24
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Lirico for 5 nights in the middle of June 2009. We had stayed here a couple of years ago, and returned as the Hotel has a good base, and was very good value for money. On our most recent visit, the Hotel has made improvements to the reception and breakfast area. These improvements did make our stay better than the last. The Lirico is very clean and even though the rooms are on the small side, they are adequate for a short stay in Rome. Everyone in the hotel is very helpful. The Lirico will not disappoint, as the location and standard of the hotel is very high,

Reviews.Title: “a perfect choice-clean, pleasant and close to main train station.”
Reviews.Author: Nicola-ssm
Reviews.Content: i stayed with my 2 small children. evrything was perfect. breakfast good. a good hard bed - great nights sleep after a long day touring round Rome.Small rooms - so what! is adequate enough and didnt go to Rome to stay in the room all day!!. i went here after reading recomendations at this site - now is my turn to warmly recomend in return. There is a litle supermarket on your right as you go out the door of hotel - just accros the road.ther are great cafes with great food(for the kids-cant beat the pasta!) and good icecream. 7 min walk from main train station(termini) and open top bus tours (round trip 2.5 hrs best way to see all -20E adult,15E kids - ticket good for 24 hrs) . Will DEFINITELY go back there when in Rome. GO FOR IT and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Recommendable”
Reviews.Author: iej
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a good value for the money. Helpful and easy going staff, clean room and good location. The breakfast was simple, but very tasty, especially the coffee! The bed and pillows were quite hard to sleep on( which we didn't mind at all, but some people might find it uncomfortable).

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel right near Termini”
Reviews.Author: jonesm99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Lirico for our honeymoon and it was a great choice. It's a 15 minute walk to the Colosseum and a 15 minute walk to Trevi Fountain. We were also able to walk from Termini to the hotel. It's nice to save on little costs like transportation during a long trip. The room was quite small, but also cozy. The staff was also very helpful. The breakfast wasn't the best we had in Europe, but was still fine. Warm croissants!

Reviews.Title: “Neat small hotel - a good basis to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: BroodjeKroket
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 4 nights. The rooms are clean and the personel in the hotel is friendly. It is a situated near a subway station and the central station of Rome. A small lift is available from the 1st floor, were the reception is. If you are looking for a nice small not to expenive hotel to explore Rome we can recommend Hotel Lirico.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing was bad”
Reviews.Author: Roffemannen
Reviews.Content: Small hotel close to station. Room was clean and I liked bathroom much. Breakfast was perfect, not to much but a good start with various things. Room was cleaned early so often finish first trip it was just to lay down in cleaned room. Personal very friendly and helpful. A good hotel for a resonably price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, above expectations”
Reviews.Author: jbtrumps
Reviews.Content: We booked a room the hotel's website with no problems. Quoted price was the price I paid. The Lirico is less than 10 minutes walking distance from Rome's main train station. You can walk to all the major sites in less than 25 minutes (Trevi Fountain, Coliseum, Forum, Pantheon are all about 15 minutes walking) The only site we didn't walk to from the Lirico was the Vatican. The room was clean when we got there the housekeepers kept it clean daily. As is the case for most of Europe, the hotel is located up a flight of 30 or so stairs so be prepared to lug your bags up when you get there. Again, we're talking about Europe so you can expect two twin beds if you book a double and there is a tiny shower that you might have a tough time getting into if you weigh more than maybe 220 lbs. Soap and shampoo is included. We didn't realize what a great quality this was until several hotels later in the trip, but the walls are upholstered which keeps the volume level down. (other Italian hotel rooms we stayed in were very "echoey", forcing us to whisper and get "shooshed" by other guests) The staff was very friendly and helpful, especially during breakfast. One note.. we took a dinner recommendation from Tony at the front desk and were extremely dissapointed. It was for a place just a couple doors down and he probably got some sort of kickback for sending us there. To sum up, the Lirico offers a great location for a decent price. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean room, affordable for Rome”
Reviews.Author: drm8256
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good deal if you want an excellent location without spending a gazillion euros/dollars. The staff speak English well and are friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and attractive. We found the mattress to be hard by our standards, but after the usual type of sightseeing people typically do in Rome, we noted to each other the hard bed but then conked out for the night. The continental breakfast with cereals, fruit, yogurt, rolls, croissants and different drinks seemed fine to us. We walked to the colosseum and tooked the metro a couple of blocks away to get to the Vatican. There are stairs to climb from the entrance to the lobby which might be a problem for some but I think the staff would help with luggage if asked. This hotel would not be a good choice for those with mobility issues. There is a small elevator from the lobby to upper floors.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - good hotel”
Reviews.Author: AHA61
Reviews.Content: Very central, close to Termini train station and close to Metro, but still not too noisy. Ok environment to walk back to the hotel at night. Walking distance to "everything" of the sights (except maybe the Vaticane). Clean and nice rooms. Delicate bath room. Some may find the mattresses a bit hard (seen that in prev. reviews too) - but we like it that way ! We had a 3-bed room and the room was practical for us. Very little noise from neighboor rooms. The breakfast was suprisingly ok for Italy (yoghurt, cerials, 3 diff. types of ham, 3 diff.types of cheese - all in packages, but that was ok.) The orange juice was the most disappointing - as others also have said, (try the other one !) Ask for coffee and tea from the waiter to be prepared fresh for you ! We ordered through booking.com and the price was exactly as said - no extras or problems.! would definately use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, perfect and near everything”
Reviews.Author: lystrup
Reviews.Content: My young sun and I (from Denmark) were in Rome for the first time. Hotel Lirico is near the railway station, near the Metro and in the middle of all the great and old buildings. You can walk from one place to the other. The hotel is perfect, and I recommend the hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetheworldr
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff,clean rooms - clean hotel ! We enjoyed the Lirico it was spotless and very comfortable.Walking distance from terminii - walking distance to many of the attractions. Cheap supermarket virtually next door. The Viminale trattoria 30 yards away very,very friendly and good snacks,drinks etc.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and easy access to metro!”
Reviews.Author: l_poppie
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lirico was easy accessible (about a 5 minute walk) from Termini station or the Repubblica metro stop. The staff was wonderful and spoke good English. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean and having a private bathroom was very nice. Breakfast was included and very tasty! There were meats, cheeses, fresh croissants and rolls, yogurt, fruit, juice, etc... The coffee was also the best I have had in a long time, there were options of coffee, lattes, or cappuccinos. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: rundymc8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Lirico for 4 nights using it as a base to see all the sights. The staff were friendly, rooms clean and the hotel has a very pleasant atmosphere. Our room was small and occasionally it was noisy in the morning (from around 8:30-9:00), although very quiet at night, but those were the only negatives - everything else was exactly what we needed and the location was excellent - we could walk everywhere which is what we were looking for (just 20 mins to most of the major attractions)and it's near the main railway station. I would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: Veraki
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I, stayed at hotel Lirico on January for 6 days. We booked through the official website of the hotel which was very simple. They do not charge your credit card, you only give the number of your card as guarantee and you pay when you leave the hotel. We paid 320 euro for 5 nights/6 days, breakfast included, great deal at our opinion.Location is the best. The hotel is near termini (2 min walk), which makes it easy for your transport. Though it is better to walk (metro has 2 lines and is not going to help you a lot) so you wont miss anything. Almost all sights are in a walking distance, Colosseum is 15min for example. Very good restaurants are near the hotel, as well as many shops. The room was spotless and we mean spotless, spacious, comfort, well decorated, TV was small but who needs TV, Rome has so many things to see and do. Very friendly staff, willing to help you at any request and the hotel has service 24 hours a day. The only disadvantage is breakfast. Poor and do not try the orange juice, trust us.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: dougalHorsham
Reviews.Content: My family and friends were meeting in Rome for a renunion with our daughter who lives in England. Needed to book 5 rooms for four nights at the beginning of our holiday and 2 rooms at the end. Having poured over all the reviews on TripAdvisor decided upon the Lirico and booked via their website. Very easy and any questions I had via email were answered within 24 hours. We also required a restaurant for Xmas Lunch and Tony at the Lirico recommended a fabulous place. Via the reviews we knew there were steps leading up to reception. It was never a problem although at the end of a huge day of sightseeing those steps seemed insurmountable. Checkin was easy and all paperwork for the 5 rooms was ready although we were too early for our rooms so all our luggage was left in the one room that was ready and off to the Hop On Hop Off Bus with a stop back at the Termini which was approx. 10 minute walk. When we called back at 12.30pm our rooms were ready. Across the 5 rooms there was quite a diverse range of sizes although everybody seemed to fit in and the rooms were spotlessly clean. Our own room was a triple which included not only an Opera View but a couch and plenty of space which proved a real bonus as the family seemed to be in our room all the time. Breakfast was your normal continental, croissants, pastries, cold meat, bread rolls, cereal, yoghurt and juices. Coffee was made to order and the young guy working in the breakfast room had us amazed with his ability to remember everyone's order and deliver it to the table to the correct person. Believe me our orders were difficult even for us so full marks to him. We found the hotel in a perfect position for walking everywhere in Rome with many little cafes and restaurants in very close proximity including an Irish Pub which our family thoroughly enjoyed. Staff were all very friendly and very helpful especially Tony although all staff we met were fabulous with a great command of the English language which was great for us as none of us spoke Italian. If I had any complaints at all it would have to be our room when we returned. Although we had a larger room on our first visit this room was small with the smallest shower cubicle I have ever seen. I am not small but not large either yet it was difficult for my husband or I to get into shower. I could not shut the door as it was just too confining. I know this one in particular was small as with all the rooms I saw there was no other shower this small. Just check when given your key if you are liable to have issues with the shower. The other small thing is the lift but providing you do not exceed the weight limit as per posted instructions you will have no issues with it. Quite functional. Would definitely stay here again though purely because of location, cleanliness and friendliness of staff. A lovely little 3 star hotel in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TexBecks
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lirico is a comfortable budget hotel and a true bargain for Rome. Our room was spacious, well lit, and best of all, quiet. The room had a comfortable bed, a sofa, a TV with satellite which meant we could pick up a few English shows, and a decent-sized bathroom. The temperature controls were easy to work, and it has both heat and AC, which summer visitors definitely will need. The only strange thing about the room is that the bathtub had no shower curtain. Breakfast was standard European breakfast-meats, cheese, bread, pastries, fruit, yogurt, juice, and coffee. The location is hard to beat--just 5 minutes from the Repubblica metro stop and a few more minutes to Termini. The restaurants in the neighborhood aren't that great, but we were hardly ever near the hotel at dinner time. We'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great stay at the lirico!!!!”
Reviews.Author: romanaMelbourne
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the lirico in the summer of 2005. The atmosphere was very pleasant, the rooms are very clean, the staff are very cordial and friendly, by the end of our stay we knew everybody by name....... We will stay again at the lirico, no doubt... We would recommand it to all our friends, which we did..... the location is excellent, well served by transportation and ideal to take long beautiful walks around the historic centre of Rome. Go the the Lirico!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad At All!”
Reviews.Author: Mark-SamAdams
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Lirico for 3 nights (10th - 13th October 2008), having been recommended the hotel by someone who had stayed previously. The hotel staff were polite, friendly and spoke good English. We booked a Superior Double Room. Our room & the hotel generally were spotlessy clean throughout. The reception area (on the first floor) was bright & fresh and our room (on the 2nd Floor) was of average size and had TV (inc Sky), double bed, bath, shower etc. Adjacent the reception was the breakfast room, where from about 7.30-10.00am a buffet breakfast was available. Breakfast was a basic continental, with good fresh coffee and everything you need to get you on your way for exploring this great city. The hotel is ideally situated approx 400m from the main station and 2 metro stops away (or 20 mins walk) from the main attractions, the Vatican is a little further (4 stops). The area around the hotel (as around most areas around train stations) is not the nicest part of Rome, but we never had any problems or even felt slighty un-easy at any time. The hotel will only accept cash payment on promotional rate bookings!! Recommended if your looking for a place to put your head down after all that Sightseeing, Pizza, Pasta & Vino!! Mark & Sam Adams (Manchester, England)

Reviews.Title: “Beware!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheTitch
Reviews.Content: I booked 4 nights in Hotel Lirico via the official website. I have now had to cancel my booking.....here is why. I gave them my card details on their 'secure site' (and I use that term loosely) as they require the card for authorisation...as a sort of guarantee that you will arrive on the booked date. They promise not to charge your card, and that the bill will be settled upon arrival/ departure from the hotel. However, not less than 20 minutes after filling in the booking form with my card details, I noticed some money had been taken out of my account that I had no recollection of spending. I phoned my bank and they said it had been spent in Euros in a clothing store, probably over the phone or via the internet as no pin number had been used. I immediately cancelled my card and contacted the hotel. The bank said they would send me a replacement card and I was unsure if my booking was safe as the card number I had used to book it was obviously now invalid. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, and told me that my booking was safe. At this point I was unsure how my card details had been accessed, and did not know it might be via their site. So they told me they would need my new card number as soon as it arrived, and even gave me a new link to a 'secure form' because I was obviously worried about giving out my card details again. It had all the security features from the other site i.e. the 'varified by visa' sign, 'mastercard secure' etc. And they assured me this was safe. When I got my new card I sent them the new details via this 'secure form'. No less than 30 minutes later another amount of money had gone from my account. I knew it couldn't be a coincidence so after I had cancelled my card (for the second time in 4 days) I phoned Hotel Lirico. They said they had taken an amount out as authorisation on both cards, but it would not be sent to them, just simply 'kept to one side' as reassurance of my arrival. They said the money would go back in once I arrived at the hotel. When I questioned the staff member about the previous amount being different and that it was spent in a clothes store, he got rather irate with me. All in all he was quite rude considering I had just had nearly £200 taken out of my bank account and I was clearly upset. He couldn't give me any answers and it all seemed a bit dodgy to me. Of course I immediately cancelled my booking with them all together and I'm currently waiting for my new card (the third one in 5 days). I should get my money back soon hopefully. Obviously there is no way to be 100% sure or prove that my card details were stolen through this site. However, it seemed to be too much of a coincidence that as soon as they had my card details, money went missing.....and it happened twice with two separate cards! I had my new card for no less than an hour before the second amount went missing, so I know no one else could have the card number. This does not mean that the Hotel is responsible for the fraud, but the site may not be secure. Someone may have hacked the site knowing full well people would be giving out their card details. I'm sure the hotel would have been lovely, had I actually got to stay there. This is simply a warning to everyone intending to use the official site to book a room. Don't use your card, book through a travel agents and pay by cash if you can. At least then you are covered as the travel agency holds the responsibility for the booking and your money. If you do decide to use your card, keep a close eye on your bank account and follow up any money going out that you cannot account for. Luckily I check my balance every day via a secure web connection so I noticed it. If I hadn't they could have cleared me out completely! Also, make sure you have virus and spyware protection if you do online banking, or if you use your card online at all. Also, if this has happened to anyone else using the offical Hotel Lirico site please reply. I want to know if this has happened on this site before. I think people need to be warned. All in all, please be careful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our Stay”
Reviews.Author: jenhow21
Reviews.Content: We selected Hotel Lirico because of its good reviews on Trip Advisor. It will not let you down! The staff is very friendly, helpful and all speak English. The rooms were very clean, however some rooms are larger than others (we stayed at the hotel twice--one at the begininng of the trip and then at the end). Our first stay the room was smaller, but it was still comfortable. Bathrooms are decent size with a shower/tub which is uncommom for europe. My only warning about the rooms is the wake up call. Expecting the phone to ring for the wake up call there was just a slight buzz. We over slept, but it didn't ruin our day. So if you are on a time schedule just bring a travel clock with you, just in case. Breakfast was great compared to our other hotels. Fresh gourmet coffee, cereal, filled pastries, bread, breakfast meats, yogurt and fruit. Hotel is located very close to main train termini and another metro stop. Walk to both metros/train station was under 10 minutes. Most of the major sites are 2 metro stops away, which was perfect for us. Only negatives I would say about the hotel is the hotel did not have many dinner recommendations they could offer. Only 2 that were right by the hotel. We tried one of them the first night and it was just average. We never tried their second recommendation though. We would definately stay again at Hotel Lirico, we had a great stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Shame about the recommendations”
Reviews.Author: TracyCH
Reviews.Content: Stayed once again at the Hotel Lirico having been there a few years before. The hotel reception refit had just finished and it looks very smart. However, the dining room is smaller than before, if that were possible! Travelled this time with our teenagers and baby. Disapointed to find not a single highchair on the premises which mean breakfast was a complete chore. The rooms were as spotless as before - nothing to complain about there except the hardness of the bed. The air-conditioning was a must and worked well. The main gripe we had was with the advice regarding where to eat and the trips to take. The resturant they warmly recommended we visited on our last night (having been in Italy for almost two weeks and having eaten well everywhere including Rome). It was the worst meal we've probably ever had in a resturant. Not only that they overcharged us for everything, side orders we hadn't ordered, and extortionate prices but it just left a very unpleasant taste in our mouths in more ways than one! The trip they recommended was similarly the worst bus tour to have taken. They didn't follow their published map route which meant we spend hours waiting at bus stops only to find - having rung their offices - that the route had changed and they hadn't bothered telling us! (this isn't the normal Sunday change to routes which you expect with roads closed). So Visit the Lirico for a good budget choice, enjoy the location, don't go with small children, and don't take their eating or trip advice!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: coco846
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a really good location. Its literally a 10min walk from the Trevi fountain and within walking distance to the colosseum. You can also walk to the metro station to catch a train to the vatican. The hotel itself is clean and the breakfast was just enough to get you going for the day. The hotel itself isnt entriely modern but I dont think you need that when you've been out all day and night. All you need is a comfy bed! My only advice would be to research everything before you go. Everything is easy enough to find from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “cool stay”
Reviews.Author: robertplumber
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Lirico, the hotel being spotless the staff helpful and friendly. The staff spoke excellant english and recommended places to visit and eat. Our room was spacious with a king sized bed and the air conditioning was very welcome. As others have written it is within easy reach of the sights. The station is very close and we enjoyed a trip on eurostar to Florence (Firenze), a journey time of 1:40 minutes. We found lots of local restauraunts within a few minutes walk of the Lirico. It was a very good place to base ourselves and will be first on our list if we visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: angel09
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a very good location - very close to the main train station and metro. Its an easy walk to most major sights eg. 15mins to Colosseum. Room is a good size with nice cold air conditioning for the summer months. Theres no fridge though. Shower was terrible - small, very weak and at times there was no hot water. Bathroom smelled a bit musty due to the shower curtain. First day of breakfast we couldnt get a table and actually had to sit and wait for someone to finish before we could eat. Other non weekend days were fine. Overall cant be beaten for location.

Reviews.Title: “Hard beds but Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maltloaf
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Lirico really scores on location. A 5-10 min. stroll from Stazione Termini down the busy Via Viminale takes you to the hotel which is just past the Teatro de'l Opera. Be warned, there is no lift up from the entrance and the carpet is a tad worn but DO NOT let that put you off; the hotel itself is very clean. Check-in was efficient and friendly and the the manager apolgised for the fact that our room wasn't ready even though we were ahead of check-in time; the then recommended what turned out to be an excellent little restaurant about 5 mins. walk away. Our room (son and I) was spotless and even though it overlooked the Viminale the heavy curtains kept out most of the traffic noise (what there was) at night. There was plenty of space (though those used to USA standards might disagree) and a very decent en-suite bathroom with shower over bath. My one complaint was the beds; they were HARD though a couple of other guests I spoke with thought they were fine. Breakfast is now taken in the hotel itself and was a good buffet selection of cold meats, pastries, fruit, cereals and coffee. Staff were great, ready with suggestions for restaurants nearby and amazingly helpful when I had my wallet stolen, allowing me to use the hotel phone to call England with no charge, My son and I thought it was a real bargain. Docked one start because of the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: thebladder
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights and found the hotel to be of very good quality while providing excellent value for money. The hotel is in a very good location, plenty of restaurants within in a 10 minute radius and the trevi fountain, colloseum, etc. are all within walking distance. The Vatican required the metro but there were 2 metro stations about 5 minutes from the hotel. There were 3 couples in my party and we each had a Superior Double room. I would strongly reccomend these as they are considerably bigger than the standard doubles. The only problem we had with the hotel was that the A/C in one of the rooms did not work, this was resolved the next day and in the interm (my brother and his wife were moved to a much smaller std dbl room) We recieved a Eu 50 discount on our bill for this which we felt was fair. The new breakfast room looks very nice and is probably open by now, we saw them stocking the fridges while we were leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel for location”
Reviews.Author: mirabel16
Reviews.Content: We were at the Lirico late july, in peak summer heat. They were still undergoing renovations but we heard nothing from our room and the work was being done from 8 to 5. The staff was ok when it came to help. One of the gentlemen lost his patience with our airline company when I asked him to please confirm our flight back home and told me not to worry and call myself if I was not convinced. Otherwise, helpul in finding sites or with calls. The small continental breakfast was 50 feet away from the hotel at this nice cafeteria. If you asked for extra coffee or yogourt, etc, it was charged to the hotel so no extra costs. The room itself was bigger than I had expected given the past reviews. Everything was functionnal. The "sour" smell some reviews talk about is a vinigar base product used in all of the hotels I travelled to in Italy by the way, nothing to talk about. Our A/C did break down the last night we were there but we were leaving at 3 am and didn't make a deal out of it. However I do symathise with other reviewers saying it was horrible without it... maybe not the best hotel for summer months given their track record with A/Cs... They arranged for our airport transfer and it was ahead of time and efficient. We had help going up and down the stairway with our luggage. I thought it was in a great location to get to every tourist site (except the Vatican which is a 45 minute walk) and a few blocks from the termini and popular bus stops. If you are a Rck Steve fan, check out the restaurants he suggests in the Termini area, they are close to the hotel and all very good! I wouldn't rank it as the best hotel I stayed in in Italy but certainly a good value. I would not hesitate to go back. Unless I found cheaper for the same quality!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great little bundle of potentiality”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer321
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is suitably located near the main sites in Rome as well as the main train station and many charming restaurantes. During my stay, the rooms were remarkably clean and comfortable and the receptionists were friendly, courteous, reliable and always willing to assist. The hotel is currently undergoing rennovation.It is hoped that the construction will include a lift from the ground floor to the room levels to accomodate those of us who take all our worldly possessions with us when travelling. Its affordable rates allowed me to arrange a longer stay in Rome than I had imagined. All in all, it was home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Experience with Lirico Stay - Mid July 2008”
Reviews.Author: PinoTijuana
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 who stayed at the Lirico in mid July 2008 for 4 nights. During the reservation process, I found the communication to be clear and professional; we were adviced on the renovation work and the collateral effect on breakfast. The breakfast is light (Yoghurt, cofee or tea, orange juice and a croissant), but we found it acceptable. The personnel is easy to communicate with and regardless of the continuous change of person at the "reception" (due the re-modeling there is really no reception), they all are very friendly. We booked a triple and a double, and to my surprise, they were both above average in size compared to other European cities, despite that, yes, the closets are tiny, so we only unpacked enough clothes for the length of our stay and kept the rest in the luggage. Our rooms were both on the second floor (were the "reception" is temporarily located). It is also true you need to pretty much carry your own luggage up and down the stairs at check in and check out. Once each time, so I did not find it to be a huge inconvenience. On the breakfast location, it is only half a block away down the road, and you will be walking a lot in Rome, so no big deal. I booked the Lirico based on 2 factors: Price and location and both proved to be just right. Being close to the train station was key for us as we were to move to Florence after our visit to Rome; the hotel is at an easy 5 minute walk to the Termini station and don't worry about pulling your luggage on the street, that's a very common picture in Rome. You will also find a Metro station at Piazza de la Republica which is basically opposite to Termini. One issue that did not get resolved by the hotel, was a non-workable A/C on the double room even though the issue was reported. This situation did not affect the sleeping confort on our kids, so I did not pay much attention to it. This is the only reason I have not provided a better rating to the hotel. However, it met all other expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from Hell”
Reviews.Author: DTNJLAW
Reviews.Content: Booked three nights here for three sets of travelers first week in July. The hotel is under renovation but we weren't told that before arrival. When you get there you have to carry your luggage up two flights of stairs. There is no "lobby" per se, there is a hall closet with a half door where they check you in. Proceeded to be taken to my room on the third floor via the world's smallest elevator. Down a dark hall to a dark and dreary room. The bed was like a piece of plywood, the shower door was broken, the toliet you had to pump with your foot. The room was so tiny there was about 12" on each side of the bed. I left my stuff there and went out to find a better place which I found several just a few blocks away. Of course, more money but it was worth every penny. One set of friends stayed one night and their air conditioning was broken. In Rome in the summer, this means your room is over 90 degrees. What a way to ruin your whole next day! The adverstised "breakfast" turned out to be a danish and a cup of coffee at a place several blocks away. The couple with the broken a/c checked out the next day, the third couple suffered through the experience. Now the hotel won't give us refunds. I canceled my room on American Express online and it said $189 cancelation fee which I'm willing to pay. The hotel wants to keep the money for all three days, American Express prepaid them. The couple that stayed one night prepaid through Expedia and are trying to get two nights refunded. The hotel won't respond to Expedia's phone calls and e-mails. Stay away from this place!!

Reviews.Title: “room smelled odd.”
Reviews.Author: Zelda11
Reviews.Content: I have no problem with small rooms (it should be expected in Europe) but our room had an odd odour to it. Like it had been cleaned but the cleaning product they used was souring or something. The room was verrry dated. I didn't expect anything fancy or super-modern but this was ridiculous. Wallpaper, curtains, chairs, and bedspread were all the exact same pattern... a pattern from the 1980's, and all of them were dusty. The front desk was a looong flight of stairs from the street and there is no escalator or elevator (also, not odd for Europe but there is also nobody to help you get your luggage up the stairs). The toilet sometimes kept running (and don't expect help from the front desk), and you sometimes have to sit and wait (either in your room, or on the sagging sofa by the front desk) for a seat at breakfast because there aren't enough tables.

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean and friendly little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marirosa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well priced and was very clean. The rooms were small but comfortable with TV, phone. Hairdryer in bathroom, fresh toiletries daily. The windows were solid and had shutters to drown out any city centre noise. The location is very central within walking distance to many of Rome's attractions. Close to termini station and bus stops close by. Many cafe's and restaurants in the area and across the street from the Opera Theatre. Breakfast room was small but had lots to choose from for a continental style breakfast, cereal, yogurt, fruit, pastries, breads... the capuccino coffee was the wonderful. My hustand and I travelled with our elderly family members and we found this hotel a very comfortable and friendly place to stay. The fact that there were about 15 steps to climb at the front door was no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend to anyone going to Rome”
Reviews.Author: jamesGMaidenhead_UK
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 7 nights at the Lirico in May 2008 and had a fantastic time. As other reviewers have commented, our room was small but then there is so much to see in Rome we were hardly in it! The downside to this is that there was little wardrobe space, and a mini-fridge would have been useful for drinks. The bathroom was larger than expected and very clean. My wife is a light sleeper and was worried about the noise, however we both packed earplugs and didn't use them at all. The staff at the hotel are very friendly and knowledgable about the local restaurants, and only too happy to give advice on where to go. Some people have commented about having to walk up stairs to get to the lobby - so what?! Its about 15 steps and I don't think it's fair to make such a big issue and possibly put people off from staying here. In fact the only slight disappointment we had was that the Breakfast Room/Bar was being refurbished therefore we were given a voucher each morning to get breakfast in a cafe just over the road. This may put off the steps-hating people, but in fact it turned into a positive experience as we had breakfast outside everyday. All the major sights are in walking distance, except we got the metro to the Vatican - this was quick and easy and only 1euro each way. The train station is not even a 10 minute walk from the hotel and while the guidebooks say the area around the station is dodgy at night, the immediate hotel area seemed fine and we felt safe walking around in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, great staff but loud outside”
Reviews.Author: payingitforward1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit out of the way, but comparably affordable. The room was amazing. It was so pretty. The bathroom was big, though a real shower door would be great. The housekeeping was stellar and the front desk staff was very helpful. The breakfast buffet does not offer too much selection. There are many buses that leave from around the corner to all of town. Be prepared to wake up very early as it gets very loud outside very early.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel within minutes of the train station”
Reviews.Author: firstenburg
Reviews.Content: We found hotel Lirico here (tripadvisor) and then booked on their site. The hotel was 3 blocks from the train station, which was nice because we were backpacking and on foot. It was well priced too, from all we found. Rome is small, so most things are within walking distance, if you like walking. If not they have a minimal metro system that departs from the train station. Either way this hotel is close. The staff was helpful, and the breakfasts were great! The desk guy knew of good places to eat. Our first night, he sent us with a coupon to the restaurant Barbarini, within walking distance of the hotel, and not bad food either. European hotel rooms are small, so speaking in relative terms, our room at this hotel was good sized. We didn't feel cramped. And it was clean and modern. THE ONLY DOWNSIDE: The hotel lobby is on the first floor of a building. Meaning you have to climb a tall flight of stairs to get to the lobby, there is no elevator. We were there 2 nights, 3 days, and on days when we had been out touring on foot, we didn't enjoy having to climb those 30 or so steps to get to the lobby of our hotel. All things considered, this hotel was an excellent value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “A Lucky Find”
Reviews.Author: tonyanderna
Reviews.Content: My wife and I left it a bit late to book for a long spring weekend in Rome, so it was triply lucky (a) that the Lirico had a room for us, (b) that its rate was well below the prices of some of the others we tried to book at, and (c) that it turned out so pleasantly that if we're ever lucky enough to revisit Rome I see no reason to stay anywhere else. Its location struck us as just about ideal -- everything from the Vatican to the Villa Borghese and the Palatine Hill seemed just a short walk or walk-and-ride away -- and although it is so close to major streets we enjoyed quieter nights than we do in our flat in outer London. From the receptionists to the breakfast waiter to the bed-maker, the staff were all excellently helpful and friendly, and our gross inability to speak Italian was never a handicap. Everything in the hotel, from the front door up the stairs and via the lift to our room with its tall window opening into the sunshine, was agreeable, comfortable, accommodating, pleasant in decor and just generally Right. The same went for the breakfast room, which offered a very good start to each day. Our beds were comfortable, and the room and its en-suite bathroom were distinctly roomier than many others we've found ourselves in In Europe. (The one handicap was that the supply of hot water seemed to fade out as the hour got later, so the trick was to get your bathing done early. A small price to pay, we thought, considering everything else the Lirico offered.) Judging by the breakfast room, the hotel was doing a brisk trade, yet we were never disturbed by fellow-guests -- in fact everything was so quiet that if it hadn't been for the breakfast room we might have imagined that we were almost the only people there. Thanks partly to unexpectedly beautiful spring weather, our first visit to Rome was magically enjoyable, and the Lirico helped to make it so. I am very glad indeed that we were lucky enough to chance upon it, and strongly recommend it to anyone looking for a place to stay while visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable, but not luxurious”
Reviews.Author: kulch37527
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a good location, right near Piazza Republica metro stop and main termini station. The actual hotel was OK. We went in April and they did not turn on the AC yet and there were no screens in the windows so we had to sleep with the window wide open and cross our fingers on the mosquitos. The bed was average for European standards and the shower had extremely low water pressure. But on a good note, the breakfast was great. They made fresh cappucino's for you each morning. The staff was nice and spoke English and they set-up a taxi ride for us to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leeshie
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Lirico for 2 nights during the last week of April. Once we figured out where the street signs are - it was actually really easy to find from the train station. When we got to the hotel, it was basically just as the pictures show. Check in was quick and easy - we were given room 304 I believe which overlooked Via Napoli. The room was small. Whoever took the pictures on the websites must have used a wide-angle lens! I was expecting a small room, but it was REALLY small - cruise ship small. There was a king sized bed (two twins pushed together), 2 small end tables, and a small table and 2 charis across from the bed. We ended up having to stack the chairs on top of each other so we would have room for our suitcase. Since we were only there for 2 days, we packed together in one small suitcase, and it was still a little cramped. My boyfriend removed the bed spread as soon as we entered the room - he does this pretty much everywhere we go, and he said there were some blonde hairs on it - which there were - but having friends who work in the hotel business, I know that bed spreads are NOT washed after every use - only sheets & blankets. So we really did not have a problem. Other than that, the room was very clean. The bathroom was pretty much spotless - TINY, but very clean. The only real problem we had - which I didn't even bother to report was with the air conditioning. You have to put your room key in the wall to get it to work, and it never got cool. I was actually sweating when we arrived at 2:30pm. I turned it on that night when we got back to the hotel, and we left it running all night and it was NOT cool. The second night we left the window open and that worked really well. The street the hotel was on was quiet at night, and it was nice a cool in the evenings. The bed was not exactly comfortable, but I've slept on worse. It was big - which was nice. One side was very hard - which I don't really have a problem with - and the other side was more uncomfortable b/c you could feel the springs. But after our long days of walking around the city, we had no trouble falling asleep. Breakfast was a lot better than I had expected based on other reviews. They had rolls, croissants, donuts, spreads - nutella, butter, cheese, cold cuts, fruit, coffee, cereal, juice, etc. And the people at the front desk were VERY nice and helpful. They helped us figure out the best way to go to some of the sights, and when my boyfriend had a blister, they pulled out the first aid kit to help me find a bandage. Check out was easy and quick. We walked everywhere - didn't use any public transportation or tours. Everything is about 15 minutes walk. We even walked to the Vatican and back. The map they give you at the hotel is better than the map we brought from our tour book and we relyed on that pretty much the entire time. I felt like the area around the hotel was decent. It's like 3 minutes walk from a big shopping area and not far from the Colloseum. There was a homeless man sleeping in the alley alongside our hotel street, but I saw them all throughout the city and didn't feel unsafe. The only time I felt slightly unsafe was when we were trying to find this restaurant at night that my tour book recommended. After about 45 minutes of searching in the dark alleys near the Colluseum, I decided the place did not exist and we gave up. That was the only time I felt like we were in a slightly seedy area - and we left and went back to the Trevi Fountain area after that to search for restaurants. Overall we had a good experience at the hotel. I would recommend it to anybody who is doing like we did - spending a very short time in Rome, who wants to be within walking distance to the train station and major sites without relying on public transportation, and wants a clean, safe hotel to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: MauraCarvalho
Reviews.Content: We really loved our 2 night stay at this hotel. It is a small but cosy hotel, the breakfast room is lovely and the staff is very helpful and gives you good advice on where to eat, how to go somewhere, etc. The rooms are clean and pleasantly decorated. Don't take heavy luggage, as you have to climb some stairs to get to the hotel reception! Maura Portugal

Reviews.Title: “Great Great Great”
Reviews.Author: jry-i
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service in an ideal location. Rooms are small but cheerful and clean. The service is surprisingly cheerful and more than willing to help with tours, taxis, restaurants and other tips. I would recommend this hotel over any other that I have used on my numerous trips to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Audrey80
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have just returned from a five night stay in Rome and would definately recommend this hotel. We found it difficult to choose a hotel as there are so many, but were very pleased we chose this one. We flew with Ryanair into Ciampino Airport and got the Terravision coach to Termini Station (14 euros each return). You can buy tickets on the internet or at the airport (Prestwick or Ciampino). The journey takes around 40 minutes and they are every half an hour. The bus drops you off at a side entrance to the station, so beware of this when trying to orientate yourself and find your hotel (you can ask for a map of the city centre when you buy your bus tickets). To get to the Hotel Lirico from Termini Station you would be best going into the station through the entrance where the bus drops you off (at this entrance there are two restaurants, one on either side, think one is a burger/steak place). Walk straight through the station to the exit on the opposite side. Once you leave the station, cross the road and turn right, walk along the street (parallel to the station - Via Giovanni Giolitti). Keep going along this street for three blocks, Hotel Lirico is on the street Via Viminale. There is a large Museum on the corner - National Rome Museum. Pass this and turn down to the left. Keep going down this street, the hotel is on the right handside, just past the Opera Theatre. The first few days of our trip the weather was pretty bad, so even although most of the famous sites are within walking distance, we used the Metro to get around. Both the Repubblica and Termini stations are closest to the hotel. Its 1 euro each for a single trip ticket and 4 euros each for the full day. If you are going to go to the Vatican Museums we would recommend you have an early start that morming to avoid the queues. When we were there it was closed on the Sunday, so went back on the Monday, only to find queues with a 2 hour waiting time. We got up early on Tuesday morning and arrived just before 8am, there was only a very short queue, it opened at 8.30am and we were straight in. We also enjoyed the Castle Sant'Angelo (5 euros each for entry). Its very interesting to look around and you can get really good views (and photographs) of the city from the top of the castle. Beware of people asking you to sign a petition against drugs outside the castle - once you sign they expect a donation - we were conned into it! There are independent guides at all the main attractions but the only place we took a guided tour of was the Colosseum. It was 21 euros each for the tour, which included your entrance fee of 11euros. It is worth noting that if you are under 16 or over 65 some of the attractions have free entry - as long as you have documents with you to prove your age. There are lots of restaurants to choose from - one we especially liked was called Pizzeria Est Est Est on Via Genova. Only a few streets form the hotel. Lovely brushetta, great pizzas and nice wine. The hotel itself was exceptionally clean, our room was cleaned and fresh, fluffy white towels replaced each day. Our room was of adequate size, the bathroom was quite small, but again spotlessly clean. The breakfast was fine, but nothing to shout about. The two same cereals to choose from, fruit juice, bread rolls, jams, cheese, italian hams and pastries. We had cappucinos each morning, which were delicious! All in all we had a great time and would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: grishayoyo
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome for my birthday, we booked a flight and were looking for a resonable priced hotel not too far from the center. not something too classy but not one of those places where you have to pay for the airconditioning... we found Hotel Lirico on the net after searching tens of others. the price was right and the pictures looked good. we were so happy to discover that : 1. Even though check-in is at 14:00, our room was ready at 11:00 when we got to the hotel and we were let in (without advanced notice). 2. The staff was friendly, cheerful and helpful, especially Tony who suggested a wonderful restaurant for my birthday, made the reservations and followed up on our experience ! 3. Breakfast was beyond our expectation - cheese and cold cuts, cereal, croissant (3 kinds), jams, honey, Nuttela, a veriety of coffee and hot drinks to choose from, soft drinks and most of all - fresh fruit (which is not common in rome as we heard). All buffet and plenty. 4. The room was spacious and the bed was a Queen size bed. the matress a bit too hard for me but seemed to be new. There was a small bath with plenty of hot running water arround the clock and A TOWEL WARMER.There was a large closet and two mirrors, one full size ! The elevator to the 3rd floor was never busy when we needed it. 5. Our room was cleaned every day, the sheets were clean and so was the bathroom. 6. Location - Exelent, within a walking distance of almost everywhere (exept the Vatican), there is a supermarket accross the street. Down side - there are about 20 steps to climb... OVER ALL - WE FEEL LUCKY TO HAVE CHOSEN LIRICO !

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, But Lousy Phone Service”
Reviews.Author: Yobabs
Reviews.Content: My 12-year-old son and I stayed at the Hotel Lirico during Thanksgiving break, November 18-26, 2007. As everyone says, the location is great – five minutes’ walk from Termini Station, which gives great access to trains, both metro lines, and numerous useful shops. We had a “superior” room; being off-season, the price was the same as for a regular room. The room was a reasonable size, with twin beds, plus a couch/day-bed, table with two chairs, full-sized full bath, and a little foyer. There was plenty of space for the two of us. I felt that we got very good value for our 85 euros/night. Breakfast was typically European, with fresh hard rolls, salami, ham, cheeses, pastries, juices, fresh fruits, and coffee. You can order a pot of American coffee, or get espresso, latte, cappuccino, etc. - so why settle for a pot of American coffee? The breakfast room doesn’t open until 7:30, but we found that, if we had an early train to catch, the breakfast staff were quite accommodating about letting us pick up some food to take with us. (If you do this, remember to bring something to carry it in.) In response to complaints in earlier reviews about the orange juice: the orange-colored drink is NOT the orange juice. Try the red stuff; it’s blood-orange juice, and it’s quite tasty. The room was quite clean, unless you happened to look under the bed. (Something rolled under there, or I wouldn’t have.) There was enough dirt under there to count as arable land. The beds are, indeed, hard. In fact, if you are looking for a softer sleep surface, try the tile floor. I am the world’s worst sleeper, so, having read several complaints about the hard beds, I brought along a memory-foam mattress topper, and it worked great. I had read complaints about the blankets being filthy, but they seemed pretty clean to me, so they were new, or recently cleaned…or I just have low standards. The sound-soak stuff on the walls was loud, in appearance, but did its job pretty well. I still used earplugs at night, to block out the rest of the ambient noise, but the room was generally pretty quiet. But the place wasn’t perfect. The hotel’s phone system sucked big-time. My husband and daughter were holding down the fort in Colorado, and we planned on talking each day on the phone. I would text-message my husband, and he would call us via the hotel number, so that we could take advantage of the much-lower calling rates for calls originating in the US. Trouble was, the connection would fade in and out with frustrating regularity, and sometimes the call would drop entirely. I re-seated the connections, but no luck. We asked for a different phone, but the desk said they didn’t have any more…and that they thought it was the line anyway. Well, they wouldn’t have said that if they hadn’t had complaints about it before, so I was a bit put out that, knowing the phone lines sucked, they hadn’t addressed the problem. (We ultimately worked around it by buying an Italian SIM card for my cell phone; I’d text-message my husband, and he would call my cell phone. In Italy, they don’t charge the call recipient at all, so it only cost me for the text message. Fortunately, I had already verified that my phone was quad-band, and got the unlocking instructions from our cell carrier, AT&T, before leaving on the trip.) The desk staff is still pretty pushy about the restaurant called Barrocco. Tony, in particular, was reluctant to take “no” for an answer, on that one. They must be getting one heck of a kick-back. Also, despite earlier reviewers saying that hot water was always available, we did not find that to be the case. In fact, on four occasions during our 8-day stay, we turned on the shower only to find that there was no hot water at all. The front desk said to let it run, but we let it run for 8-10 minutes, with no result. This would not have been so bad, except that my son developed a case of croup, and from past experience, a steamy shower was what he needed – but two of the times we needed to get some steam into him, there was none to be had. Other items of note… the hotel did not supply a box of tissues, which is fine, provided you are not expecting them to. I would have brought a box from home, if I’d known. Also, we found that the Gran Caffe Portioli, which is on the way home from Termini Station, on Via de Viminale (i.e., the same street that the hotel fronts onto), was a reasonable place to pick up dinner on the way home from day-trips. They do a pizza Margherita for 6 euros; it’s the size of a medium pizza in the US, and their Margherita is just a cheese pizza. They also offer a range of sandwiches, and a small selection of gelati. If we had it to do all over again, we would happily stay at the Lirico. No place is perfect, but all in all, the Lirico offered excellent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Charming a pleasant”
Reviews.Author: JamesPrstr
Reviews.Content: Pleasant, very clean and beautifully decorated. Ample breakfast. Very pleasant. Please realize that Rome Hotels within the older sections of town offer small rooms. This was very small - - - can't do anything else but accept that. It was very friendly, ehlpful, comfortable and very nicely run. I stayed at two other hotels and , although this was a small room, it was cramped but it was better than the two other places I stayed at. i would recommend it. Accessbile to all metro systems. I would, however, highly recommend you just look for restaurants on your own - - -

Reviews.Title: “The Lirico Made Me Feel at Home”
Reviews.Author: torn8o
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lirico is perfect for Rome. Absolutely ideal. Very close to Termini (we walked to and from), beside the Liric Operahouse. The neighborhood is quiet and perfectly suited for eating any type of food you want, or foot travel to all of the best Rome spots. It's an easy walk to Trevi Fountain, and about a mile to the Colosseum. The staff were warm, friendly, and very helpful. Our room was the double superior, with two twins and a daybed that is also a twin. We opened the shutters each morning and welcomed the city back into the room, and kept them closed at night for a nearly soundproof sleep. Beautiful decor, crystal clean, great breakfasts. I will easily stay here the next time I am in Rome. I wouldn't want to risk staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Almost completely ideal Roman hotel”
Reviews.Author: Poppy85
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed at the Hotel Lirico, Rome in April of this year which we booked via lastminute.com. (Apologies for the late review!) The best thing about this hotel would have to be the location. It is just around the corner from Piazza della Repubblica metro station which is so convenient for travelling around the city. About 15 min walk to the Colosseum/Forums. It is also situated on a very quiet street so not too much mad Italian traffic going by which was great! We also had a view of the dome of Santa Maria Maggiore out of our window which was v.nice. Handy supermarket across the road too. The room was quite small but this is the norm for Roman/most European city hotels and lets face it, who goes to Rome to sit in their hotel room?! It was spotlessly clean which is always the main factor for me and the bathroom was v.modern, tiny but modern! Very eh, lurid Louis XVI/flowery style soundproof type padding on the walls which wasn't very pretty but it did the job,never heard a sound! Adequate storage space,tv (lots of Serie A football on much to my boyfriend's delight and welcome distraction while I was getting ready to go out!) ,little table and chairs, sewing kit and lots of helpful literature on things to do in the city,restaurants etc. which was very good. We never had the breakfast so I can't comment on that aspect. Most of the staff however left a lot to be desired which is why I'm not giving it a higher rating. The man when we were checking in never welcomed us to the hotel and barely even looked at our faces, not very pleasant. This continued throughout our 6 night stay and by the end we had taken to giving him an extremely sarcastically bright "BUON GIORNO!" everytime we passed; didn't amuse him much but we got a laugh out of it! This was the mood amongst almost all of the workers. The only pleasant member of staff we encountered was the night manager who was very jolly and always full of suggestions of where to go for dinner. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody travelling to Rome. I've been to the city 5 times and this was the best hotel I've stayed in for location, comfort and value. It was also a very safe area and near Termini but not too close if you get my drift...! We were out late quite a few nights and never felt any unease. Check out the nearby Via dei Serpenti for loads of wonderful non-touristy restaurants always full of Italians, which is obviously a great sign. Ciao! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: fijova
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lirico was awesome. We stayed there from October 2nd to October 4th, 2007. It is very clean and very close to the Termini. Our room was a double standard - it was a small room but comfortable. The bathroom was super clean. The bed was a bit hard to sleep on. The breakfast room was nice and airy and the breakfast was awesome. All the staff were super nice and helpful. They have a website - you can contact them directly and all my emails and questions and concerns were answered the next day at the latest. I loved this place and we would definitely stay here again. I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: SannaK
Reviews.Content: Very clean, great location near the station, good airconditioning, ok breakfast, good service at the receptions. Will stay again! Rooms small, but it's always like that in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ichy-feet-size-7s
Reviews.Content: we have just return from a 3 night stay at the lirico. we had a triple room which was a good size for the 3 of us, comfortable and very clean. we spent little time there as we were out most of the day. The hotel lift is very small and there is a flight of steps up to the reception from the street. The breakfast room was quiet small, and very busy on the second morning. The location was excellent near the railway station. Very friendly and helpful staff all spoke english very well. If like us you are looking for a decent hotel with no frills this is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: juliemtalbot
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lirico twice during September. 3 days at the beginning of our holiday and 2 at the end. The location of the hotel is excellent being just a couple of minutes from the station. Be aware that the size of the rooms vary. Our first couple of days were in an excellent room on the fron of the hotel but the second visit our room was MUCH smaller and there was no difference in price. Staff were very helpful, booking taxi and tickets for museums etc. Hotel was very clean as were our rooms. Breakfast however was not brilliant but adequate. Anyone with walking difficulties should note there is a large flight of stairs up to reception and there is no lift until you are in the reception area. On the whole this is a good value hotel in a superb location and I would certainly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ViaPompeii
Reviews.Content: I traveled alone to Rome. The Hotel is within close walking distance to the the Rome Termini and Rebublica Piazza (metro). There is a supermarket right across the street, a cafe and coffee bar nearby. Tony was wonderful. Speaks great English and you can tell he enjoys his job. The Hotel has one flight of stairs to get to the main lobby, but it's nothing too bad if you are in halfway decent shape. Tony also pointed out a nice, affordable restaurant. I had already been to this restaurant so he was right! The rooms were very clean. Beds comfortable. Shower small, but I had hot water immediately with every shower and good pressure. The hotel is quiet, unlike many of the hotels I've stayed in. I paid alot more for a hotel just around the corner last year and Hotel Lirico is just as good but much less expensive. I had to catch an early train and the bar for breakfast wasn't opened yet. The man behind the counter offered and made me a cappucino for the road! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, convenient”
Reviews.Author: njdaveus
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed four nights in August at the Lirico, good air conditioning, clean rooms and bathrooms. The breakfasts were satisfying and the desk staff friendly - recommended good local restaurant. Like the convenience to the termini and main thoroughfares - but on a quiet street with the grocery story across the street for snacks and drinks. Hope to return again soon. The only draw back is the long flight of steps up to the lobby - pack light!

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean hotel in good location. Would visit again”
Reviews.Author: groverss
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a week in August. At first glance, the street it is on does not look like much but you will soon realize that this is the way most of Rome is! Like others, have said, there is a long flight of stairs to get up to the hotel. The people are friendly and to get to your room you have to take a very small elevator that the 2 of us just managed to squeeze into with a suitcase each. Our room was smaller than most rooms I have been in but then again, all you really need the room for is somewhere to sleep at night and to wash. The room was very clean and the floor is tiled, rather than carpeting! The bathroom was also clean, with the usual soap, shampoo, shower caps and plastic cups provided.
