There was also a shower and a bathtub, though this was half the size of a normal one, so I don't think it would be very comfortable! Breakfast is served from 7:30 to 9:30 a.m. The room is small in size with about 9 or 10 tables, however, we never had any problem getting a place to sit, especially if we went early. Breakfast consists of 2 different types of cereeal; one is chocolate puffs a little similar to Kellogg's Coco Pops and the other were like rice krispies but were flakes. (I don't know if these change from time to time but they had the same ones for the week we were there). They also have some croissants and danishes and some hard round bread rolls. There was a selection of different toppings such as nuttella chocolate, cheeses and jams to go on top. You are also offered tea or coffee. The hotel is in a great location and you can walk to every major attraction without any difficulty. The main termini train station is literally 5 minutes around the corner. We got to the colosseum in about 20 minutes, and that was walking slowly to take in the other sites and stopping for photographs. The furthest place to walk to would be Vatican City, but even that is not too bad. The Metro is a good way to get to places a little quicker. If you are looking for machines to buy tickets for it in the train station, follow the signs for the metro and the machines are right before you go through the turnstiles. There is a supermarket in the basement of the building next door. You will get basic things here but it is small. There is a Spar shop on Via Nazionale, which is the next street over and this has more in it and is also open until later at night. There is another supermarket in termini as well so you really will not be stuck if you need any essentials or some food. The best way to get to this hotel from Leonardo Da Vinci Airport is the Leonardo Express. It leaves the airport every half hour at 37 minutes past the hour and 07 minutes past the hour. It costs 11 euro for a one way ticket. The journey takes about half an hour and then it is only a five minute walk to the hotel, which is not bad when you are dragging your suitcase behind you. When we were leaving the hotel, we were thinking about getting the hotel to organise a transfer for us, but that turned out to be 45 euro. So we decided to walk back to termini and get the Leonardo Express again. It leaves termini at 22 minutes past the hour and 52 minutes past the hour. We found it hard to know where to buy tickets for this in the station but if you head towards the train itself, there is a man in a booth who will write you out a ticket for a euro or two extra. This still beats paying 45 euro in the hotel! Overall, we had a very pleasant stay in our hotel. The street is quiet so there are no loud noises at night. There are many restaurants in and around it so you should have no trouble finding something to eat.. I would recommend staying here,especially for its good location!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Earlp78
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Lirico for a 3 night break in August and loved it. This hotel is just a short taxi ride from the Airport (cost us about €40 inc a tip) and upon our arrival we were greeted by Tony who was a really nice guy and very helpful. Our room was lovely, clean and fresh. The bathroom was fine, lovely and clean, the bath was only a 3/4 one, but it was not a problem as the powerful shower more than compensated. The hairdryer in the bathroom was great (they maybe small, but are really powerful!) Our rate included breaky which was nice enough, just basic ceral, fruit, with bread rolls, jam, butter etc, but very nice all the same. The best thing about this hotel is the location! Tony gave us a great map upon our arrival which clearly showed all the major landmarks. They all look rather a way away from each other, but in fact we managed to walk everywhere. The Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Colliseum etc were all about a 15min walk from the hotel, which in nice weather was lovely to do. Make sure you visit the "Tomb of the Solider" and go up to the observation deck, the views are fantasic and well worth the cost of a few euros! One tip I would give you is if you sit down in any of the street cafe's please check the cost of drinks etc before you order as we called in one by the Trevi Fountain got charged about £16.00 for a small can a beer and a diet coke!!!!!!!! needless to say we learnt our lesson after that! All in all in it was a great break and a lovely hotel, I'd def recommend. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: rnbill
Reviews.Content: Small, three-story hotel. Room was tiny but adequate for two adult tourists. Double bed w/small table and two chairs. Closet w/safe. Both it and the bathroom were clean. Bathroom had modern hardware. Shower had vinyl doors that opened a forearm's length at a corner. Definitely not for the large person. TV (with remote) on the wall with several channels in English. All clerks were pleasant and helpful. (Arranged taxi to airport - 30" ride - without a problem.) Continental breakfast - all you want - with fresh pastry and delicious cappucino. (Juice and cereals also.) Hotel next to opera house and within walking distance of good shops, the Forum and the Colosseum and many other attractions and the Termini station. Fabulous restaurant nearby - Ristorante Giglio. One negative - for some. There are 24 steps from the street to the reception desk on 1st floor. No lift. A lift (for no more than 3 persons at one time) is available from the 1st floor to the 3rd.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked the Lirico”
Reviews.Author: traveladdict941
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Lirico mainly because of the great price and the convenient location. The Termini train station is about a five minute walk from the hotel. Our room was clean and small, but the staff made the stay very enjoyable. The continental breakfast in the morning was good as well. Yes, the immediate perimeter around the train station is a little shady, but the area surrounding the Lirico a few blocks away was very nice. For the price, the customer service, and the location, this hotel was a great catch.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: reptar
Reviews.Content: Rome is awesome and this hotel is a great value and close enough to many sights. Additionally it is very close to the metro and buses for additional sights. Very helpful and friendly staff. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel - very happy”
Reviews.Author: Catalina30Dublin
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel and were very happy. Walking distance of the train station and shopping. Close to all of the sites. Small lovely property. Only one drawback: don't accept credit cards. We were hard pressed to get enough cash to pay our bill as we had extended our stay from one night to 4 nights. In the overall picture, very minor. Massimo was very helful and really values good customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: choward1
Reviews.Content: Great location - only fifteen minutes walk to the Colosseum and to Spanish Steps/Trevi fountain. A minute to Via Nationale where the bus for the Vatican leaves from. Several restaurants around and safe area at night - just far enough away from the train station. The hotel itself is small but very clean and the staff are very helpful and friendly with very good English. Breakfast is just crossaints and rolls as in most hotels in Italy. The hotel is on the first floor of the building and there is no lift to this floor but there is a lift to all other floors from the first floor. One small annoyance was their website listed a safe in each room but to use it was €2.50 per day. The hotel is about ten/fifteen minutes walk from the train station so with a lot of luggage I would recommend getting a taxi. It is easy to find though from the directions on the website. Be careful around the train station as pickpockets and beggars are plenty! The Trevi fountain and Spanish Steps are a pickpockets paradise otherwise as a single traveler I found Rome itself was very safe. Definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but Central”
Reviews.Author: yassyt
Reviews.Content: First and foremost this Hotel is very Central. You are within walking distance of all of the sights and that is all we really wanted from the Hotel, that and cleanliness. In relation to both points, this Hotel gets a hug thumbs up. The bedroom was small but spotless, as was the Bathroom. It comes equipped with a hairdryer but I would bring my own if I were you otherwise you will spend the whole time in the Hotel trying to dry your hair.... It takes forever. Like I said the room was small and very basic but it did the job for our own purpose because we didnt spend a lot of time there. It is a small bit disheartening as there are a lot of stunning Hotels near by and yours feels very shoddy in comparison but like I said it was suitable for its purpose. The Matrress on the bed was extremely hard, it was the firt thing I noticed as I flopped on to it as soon as we arrived but it didnt ruin my sleep so I cant really complain. The Staff are very friendly, on the first night they advised where to go for dinner, the couple behind us then asked and it was clear that his sppech was rehearsed as he repeated word for word what he had told us. When we arrived at the Restaurant, it didnt look great so we went about finding our own place to eat (thats not to say it wasnt nice, it could have been). Regardless, there are loads of Restaurnats near by. It states on the webiste that the Hotel is located in a Traffic Restricted area and therefore unauthorised vehicles cannot gain entry without first alerting the Transport Department. Becuase of this, we asked the Hotel to arrange a Taxi to collect us from the Airport. This set us back €50.00 and a normal taxi into the city would only have cost €20.00 and the train/metro only €7. We felt a bit ripped off by this, especially to discover that it was not in a traffic restricted area at all. It was handy having the taxi collect us when we had no idea where we were going but it is literally off of Via Nazionale so if at all possible I would advise you make your own way. Overall, the stay was very nice. We did not have breakfast becuase it didnt state whether or not it was included in our stay. We were afriad we would be charged astonomically for it. Also we left the Hotel quite early each day so we didnt really have the time to stop. Thus I cannot comment on the breakfast but the breakfast room looked pleasant. A final comment is that we decided to be very cultured and to go to the Opera one night (it was great - I am not an Opera fan but I really enjoyed myself) we asked Reception if there was any on during our stay and they said no. the opera we went to was literally about ten paces down the road and we happened to stumble on it by chance. A little disappointed that they didnt tell us about it becuase it was so excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Venky_rs
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and neat. Breakfast was included. The breakfast room is small but we never had trouble getting a seat. Hotel is very close to the station. I booked the room through their website. When I checked in I was informed that I have to pay for the room with cash only since we were offered promotional rate of 75 Euros per night. It would have been nice if they had informed us before itself since we didn't convert enough dollars to euros to cover the room cost as well. Another annoying thing about the hotel is that the front desk managers try to push their customers to few of their select restaurants nearby. First time I fell for it and had dinner at a pricey restaurant. But the following night I kindly declined their recommendation and I was let alone. Other than these annoyances, the stay at the hotel was plesant.

Reviews.Title: “New Year in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Gatorloz
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lirico Suitably situated from the Termini, trains run directly from the airport to the Termini pretty much every 30 minutes. We got straight off the plane and onto a train, which took us about 45 minutes to the Termini and within 10 minutes (including a detour when I got us lost) we were at the hotel. We arrived at about mid-day and our room was already available, which was great. The staff were friendly and exceptionally helpful, they supplied a very useful and detailed map of Rome to help us explore, checking in was really quick and painless (although the luggage lift was out of order and I had to carry the case up about 30 steps). Rooms were compact but with enough room for the two of us, comfy and warm, we were situated on the first floor overlooking the Theatre Di Opera, but even though we were there for New Year there was little disturbance for the whole 5 nights we were there. As in a number of the reviews above the hotel staff recommended the Il Barocco restaurant, which was delightful and the food was spectacular, the 'Veal in a Marsala sauce' was to die for, and highly recommended. Anyway there are plenty of other great restaurants within 2 or 3 minutes walk, the hotel is convenient for most of the tourist sights which are within walking distance, but beware the cobbles can make your feet ache. Alternatively the metro is great value at 1 Euro for 75 minutes travel, or 4 Euros for a whole day. although in fairness we walked most everywhere. One thing we must say about Rome is that around New Year, if you have a nervous tendancy, heart condition or an intolerance to loud noises then do beware, the locals have a tendency to throw loud fireworks bangers (and even catherine wheels) into the middle of the street with complete disregard for anyones safety, also the bottle throwing can be definitely unsafe!! In conclusion it is a guarantee that we will definitely visit Rome again, and the Hotel Lirico will most definitely be on our list of reasonably priced and very accessible accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Great value central spot”
Reviews.Author: cjBath
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a full nine nights over Christmas and had absolutely no complaints at all. Very friendly and helpful staff, a clean and well-serviced spacious room, great breakfasts (continental but all-you-can-eat buffet style, good coffee too) and centrally located. Although it is near to Termini station (where the airport buses unload) we had no sense of the area being seedy or run down - there are beggars in the next street, but then there are beggars all over Rome, and none of them are particularly threatening. Very useful supermarket right next door, and a Tabacchi round the corner for getting that very useful Bus/Metro pass. Weekly ones are 16 euros: great value. Nice little touches over Christmas included tinsel round our room number, and recommendations on local places to eat. We ended up eating in the Jewish ghetto on Christmas Day, and it was an excellent meal. Winter is a good time to see Rome - fewer crowds at the sights. We'd definitely stay at the Lirico again.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in heaven”
Reviews.Author: theotherkaren
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel! The staff were friendly and eager to make sure that we were comfortable. Our room was lovely and spacious with a great view over the opera house. The hotel gave us a map of Rome with the hotel marked on it which we used everyday! It is a simple 10 minute walk down to the main ancient sites and the restaurants around the area are great!! This hotel is not in the main party or shopping part of the city, but it is brilliantly located for site seeing and is close to two metro stations. We were really impressed with the hotel and would definitely recommend it to anyone who was going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dalton_Russell
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews about the Hotel Lirico my comments will not come as a surprise to those reading this review. I had booked directly with the hotel through their website, which is available in several different languages. I paid 350 euros for four nights, which is actually a decent price given that hotels in Rome can easily cost more. One thing worth bearing in mind if you book directly with the hotel is that if you take up a promotional rate then you must either pay in cash or travellers cheques when checking out. In fairness to the hotel, it is in a fairly good location. The forum and Coloesseum can be reached easily; it's about a 20 minute walk. There are two Metro stations nearby and you can get a bus to the airport from near the station. There are plenty of fine churches in the immediate vicinity, but places like the Vatican are only a short tube ride away. Of course there was a downside to the hotel. There is no lift to the reception area which means hauling your luggage up a flight of stairs first. The room I stayed in was small; the room my relatives also stayed in was small and that was meant to be a double room. Their website indicates that rooms are soundproof; having stayed in the room next to the toliet in the breakfast area I can confirm that it is not the case and anyone who stays in that room has my sympathy as you will be woken at six in the morning by staff using that toilet. My bathroom was clean; my relative's bathroom was smaller and theirs was a double room. The breakfast bar is also small; although I did not have to wait for a table, some people did. The breakfast is enough to keep you going until lunch. If you are looking for a basic three star hotel with a central location and are not expecting too much for your money then staying there is an option; just be aware of the downsides that's all.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Good for a short break.”
Reviews.Author: Morison
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Lirico is ideal for a short break on a bit of a budget. Conveniently located to all the main tourist attractions, we walked eveywhere and it was fine, although at the end of the day sometimes I thought my feet were dropping off but hey! Reception staff are quite pleasant and are quite welcoming.On arrival, we arrived about 6pm, the receptionist recommended we go for something to eat at a restaurant called IL Barocco, we did go there but think that there are better places that arent full of tourists, its nice to sample a place where "everyone" doesnt go, we were there when 2 large table of Americans were eating and they were really loud giving the waiters all types of problems and giving Americans a really bad name by being so obnoxious and rude!Anyway enough on that! I think you can find somewhere else close by, we ate on the last night close to the hotel, the restaurant was called "New Mary Meeting" on Via Genova,(See Pic) I know it doesnt sound too italian but it was excellent, good service and local italians were eating there, they have a good menu as well, everything from Pizza - Pasta to chips ! Good quality as well. More on the hotel, the breakfast was basic(see Pic), normal european brekkie, bread,pastries,salami,cereal, coffee and juices. The hotel is close to underground stations etc but we didnt use them,didnt feel like catching a train from the airport so had a airport shuttle, which was great, crazy italian drivers, but saw some good sites.At the entrance to the hotel you do have to carry your suit cases up some stairs to the reception area. Overall the hotel is fine for a short break, rooms are quite small but ideal to rest your head,great Gelatera across the road for some great ice cream. I have attached pics for you to look at

Reviews.Title: “..Average..”
Reviews.Author: Craig_Woodward
Reviews.Content: We stopped here for a long weekend in September, we arrived in Rome on the underground which was easy to navigate around, from the airport was only 5 euros for 2 or us. The hotel was a little difficult to locate and when we eventually found it we were disappointed at the steep stair case to climb with baggage and no willing help from the hotel. The hotel was clean but very compact, the air conditioning was not working very efficiently and was very noisy. The location was perhaps a little far out from the main tourist haunts approximately a 30 minute walk into the centre of Rome. There were numerous places to eat local to the hotel, but we found the restaurants around the Trevi fountain were unbelievably reasonable and the food was fantastic. We shopped around and found that all accommodation in Rome was expensive, this hotel was clean, friendly, a great base and reasonable at 480 euros for 4 nights (Sept 7th - 11th).

Reviews.Title: “Fine for short stays”
Reviews.Author: purplenataliemarie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the Oct school holidays. The rooms are a good size, but for a family of three a little tight on space. OK for three nights though. A few Sky channels on the TV, buy bottled water at the nearby supermarket. The room and bathroom were very clean, the beds were comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They gave us a recommendation for a local Ristorante for dinner, called Il Barocco. The locals use it for sit down and takeaway, pop in for an expresso on their way home! Very good value, friendly service and fresh produce. I would strongly suggest you avoid Bar Washington on the same street as the hotel complete rip off, not very clean and expensive. The hotel is a very good example of a three star, Rome is expensive so you won't get the same deals as in other European cities. Try to be patient at breakfast, they only have a small breakfast room and have to relay tables to accommodate all the guests. But they do have plenty of staff on to speed things up. They have a laptop setup in the bar for Internet access, 3 euros for 30 mins. If you like Opera or Ballet the hotel is right beside the Opera Theatro. Colosseum is 20 mins away by foot.

Reviews.Title: “Ok....no more, no less.”
Reviews.Author: solid8
Reviews.Content: The Lirico Hotel is a good Hotel in the modern centre of Rome. The location is very good. Just a stone's throw from Via Nazionale. The Termini station is also nearby. Most of the city's sights are more or less in walking distance such as the Colloseum or the spanish steps. It is a modern city Hotel. The service is efficient and the staff is friendly but very very impersonal. It really lacks charm. The room we had was the smallest I've ever seen. There was nothing beside of a bed and a little desk. The bathroom was rather small either. But at least everything was spotless clean. I would stay there again because of the Hotel's excellent position and the reasonable prices but it's certainly not the right choice if you're looking for a romantic city break. PS. You get the best rates on the Hotel's homepage if you book far in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK!”
Reviews.Author: travellerina
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Lirico for four nights in October with my husband. The hotel is easy accessible by foot from the Termini Station and Metro Repubblica and bus stop are even closer (200 m). In my opinion the hotel is very basic three star hotel, rooms are small but quite nice, quiet and clean (except the blanket!). Safety box can be rent at 2,50 eur/day. Sheets were not changed during our stay, clean towels were brought avery day. Breakfast is included in the room price, a nice way to start the day in Rome and their coffee was great! A little complaint about the bed, it was quite hard, but we got used to it by the last night. Location is ok, you can walk to almost every sight or take the metro/bus if you wish (in october they were very crowded). Nice restaurants nearby, the area seemed safe even though some homeless people sleeping on the street is not very rare scene in Rome. We booked the room directly from the hotel website for 145 eur/night, which was a promotial offer that had to be paid in cash. (That was a little bit weird as using credit card is much more convenient.)

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: tigger83
Reviews.Content: This hotel has excellent location. It is just 7 mins walk away from the main Termini Station in Rome and so makes traveling around the city very easy. I went with friends and being young, we were able to walk to almost all the major attractions (Colosseum, Vatican, Trevi Fountain, etc) with ease. The hotel also has a decent buffet style breakfast. Note, the breakfast is very basic and those suited to luxary breakfasts will not be happy with the hotel's service at all. True to other reviews, the juice served is actually squash - but then again I don't think that this is a major reason to turn down a hotel so excellently loacted. In addition, those suited to larger rooms will not be happy with the room sizes. True they are quite small - just enough room in the double to get a bed and bedside tables on either side. But then again, there is so much to see and do in Rome that there really is no need to linger around in your room. The staff were also helpful and very friendly and even did some internet searches on a few local attractions on our request. They pointed out the main areas of interest and told us which buses/underground stations we needed to take for the different attractions. In conclusion, I went with my friends and wanted a hotel located smack in the center of the city that will have a comfortable bed and clean shower. Being a group of girls, we felt extremly safe in the area. As a result, I found this hotel to be excellent! On the other hand, if you're priorities are to have a large room with masses of space and gourmet breakfast, then this hotel is not for you!

Reviews.Title: “A good suprise!”
Reviews.Author: RosetteandSteph
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Lirico. Found the staff very helpful and welcoming + they spoke english! The hotel was clean, very cosy, and quiet! A nice breakfast too. There was also a supermarket next to the hotel and some nice restaurants in the street. Very close to the Termini station as well and convenient to explore Rome. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “ideal location”
Reviews.Author: trudiLeedsEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Lirico for 3 nights in June. Took the train from the airport as only 10 euros each compared to 45 euros in a taxi. Hotel in ideal location for train station and the famous sights. All were in walking distance from the hotel. We did take the subway to the Vatican only 1 euro. Please be careful of Italian children on the subway as they are there to steal out of your pockets. Hotel rooms were lovely and clean and had a very nice bathroom. Breakfast was nice very basic of cereal and croissants and coffee but that is all you need when staying in Rome as the food is fabolous. We would definatley use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Near the Train Station”
Reviews.Author: MKMCDONALD
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lirico met our needs as budget travelers. We were taking trains through Italy, so we wanted to be within walking distance of the train station, but also close to the attractions. Our room was clean, and the bathroom was large and modern - better than expected! The breakfast room was very nice, but we generally ate at local cafe's. One unexpected detail - the power in the room only worked when your room key was inserted into the power switch, so there was no chance to charge batteries while out of the room or with the lights off. I have recommended this hotel to friends and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly nice place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Hotel Lirico. The accomodations were above adequate. The AC and lights in the room took us a little while to figure out but both worked fine. No refrigerator in the room but there was a tv, hair dryer and full bathroom. The free breakfast downstairs was decent: fruit, cereal, croissants and hot coffee/cappucino. The hotel was located in a good spot, only a 5 minute walk to the train station. We walked to most of the attractions in 15-25 minutes. Took the subway to the Vatican, station was less than 5 minutes from the hotel. The staff was not overly friendly but decent enough. They arranged for a private driver to take us to the airport for $45euros. Was nice to ride in a full sized Mercedes after seeing nothing but mopeds and mini's for 2 weeks. We would probably shop around for a different hotel if we returned to Rome but we would be satisfied with staying here again if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Remanso
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 9 days at the Lirico. It is in a perfect location for exploring Rome, either on foot or by public transportation. The room was clean and adequate, although it could use more shelf space. The staff were generally friendly and helpful, especially Badol who is an outstanding employee. The breakfast was quite good, adding to what I believe to be a real bargain for a budget conscious traveler in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with some quirks...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Hotel Lirico in Rome recently. The location was good - right near Termini train station and definitely walking distance to a lot of sites, shops and restaurants. It was also located next to a supermarket which was very handy. The room itself was very clean and fairly spacious (as was the bathroom). The main issues we had were that the bed was very uncomfortable -- it was very hard and made it difficult to fall asleep. Also, everytime the room was made, they would spray this horrible scented baby powder musk spray that would not leave the room. All in all, Hotel Lirico is a good value and I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very good - more than adequate”
Reviews.Author: Cath_Shuttlewood
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lirico for 3 nights with my mum (my last weekend away with her before getting married!) and I have to say it was more than adequate! The room, whilst not huge was clean and had everything in it that you'd need - and let's face it, with Rome on your doorstep why would you want to spend too long in your room anyway?! Breakfast is plentiful and whilst there are many 'complaints' on here relating to the orange juice, it is worth pointing out that this isn't orange juice but in fact orange squash as you get in so many independent European hotels. Munch your way through all the delicious pastries though and the orange whatever will fade into insignificance! Everything (yes, even the Vatican) is within walking distance and I'd recommend this as opposed to public transport since then you get to discover all the hidden gems that Rome has to offer. The free map that the hotel gives you at arrival is invaluable and you'll see many a tourist referring to it on your travels! I'd definately recommend this hotel to anyone who wants somewhere clean, safe and comfortable to stay and from where they can discover all that Rome has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed Hotel Lirico over Easter weekend. The room and bathroom were quite nice, of above average quality and large for a European hotel. The TV is in fact free, contrary to a previous review; it's the pay per view films that are 4 euros. Breakfast was average; the same rolls get boring quickly, and the juice is horrible, but the coffee was good. DO NOT go to the restaurant Il Barocco that the staff will inevitably recommend. They clearly get a kickback for sending you there, to the point that one of the staffers called to tell them we were coming. The dishes we ordered ranged from barely passable to downright revolting, and the house wine was probably the worst I've have in three trips to Italy. Overall, an average experience. You're not in the center of things, but you are close to Termini and have a clean, comfortable room to stay in. Just don't go to Il Barocco, seriously!!! There is a much better place just across the street from the Opera next door.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Sweetflowers
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Rome and stayed at Hotel Lirico for a couple of nights. We had a triple room which was very small and cramped. The third bed doubled as a sofa. Beds were hard. Every blanket was stained. As soon as we walked in the room and touched a wall, a big piece of molding fell off the wall. The TV is pay TV, I believe it cost 4 Euros per hour. Breakfast was ok, but juice was very watered-down Tang. No elevator - so be prepared to haul your stuff up a flight of stairs (or get the bellman to help). Had to sleep with the window wide open to the street, otherwise the room got incredibly stuffy with 3 people sleeping in such a small space. Fortunately the street noise was not bad at night, EXCEPT we were awakened at 4:30 am one morning by a streetsweeper that seemed to sit right under our window for several minutes. I finally got up to close the window, then had to open it back up again a short time later because it starting getting so stuffy again. The hotel is supposed to have air conditioning, but the staff said that they do not turn it on until the weather is warmer. On the positive side, the staff was friendly. The room and bathroom were clean (except for those nasty blankets). Our room faced the street, but fortunately was still fairly quiet at night. Located close to Termini (about 5 blocks or so). About a 15 minute walk from Ancient Rome. I will definitely look for a different place to stay next time I'm in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good location friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before Easter.Really good location next to good shopping and 5 mins from Termini station I suppose 15-20 mins for Trevi fountain walking briskly and a lot further from Vatican (not to mention queues when you get there).Staff very chatty will recommend places to eat or visit useful guide thrown in.Triple room smallish for 3 but clean and nice En suite. Breakfasts typically continental don't expect freshly squeezed orange but nice fresh bread and pastries.Not suitable for the less mobile or those who dislike lifts.Hotel web site gives good deals.

Reviews.Title: “Fine little hotel”
Reviews.Author: EllenMM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our first trip to Rome, having stayed at the Hotel Lirico for two weeks. Aside from the 25 + steps up to the lobby, we found the hotel to be quite adequate for our stay. The location was central enough to tour Rome easily, the rooms were clean and the breakfasts were fine. The juice at breakfast, as reported by others, was bad, but the rest was more than acceptable. Compared to American hotels, the rooms are small; we had a triple room for two of us, and it was okay. At 80 euros/night, it was a very good deal. Staff was helpful and pleasant, and there are plenty of moderate-priced restaurants within easy walking distance. The internet access was pricey and not great, but there's an internet cafe just down the street which is very reasonable. I have no regrets about choosing this hotel for a rather lengthy stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: suzie763
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at this hotel and I have to say this was the worst experience. It's a good location at a comperable price. When we first arrived there (after a VERY long and arduous flight) we noticed we got the worst room in the place and it was a single room (when we asked for a double). After I spoke with the owner/manager he helped us get a better room for the next night. Overall, I wasn't that satisfied this time around. I will definitely try something else the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: kommizar
Reviews.Content: The Lirico was a great hotel considering what we paid (50 Euros/night). Spottlessly clean, great housekeeping, good service from the staff and good breakfast. The location is very practical, as it is close to Termini and the Republica Metro station, and within walking distance to all the attractions and restaurants in the historical centre. We were worried that the location was a bit close to the "shabby" Termini/Esquilin area, but this was no problem. In fact, the area was very nice, the hotel laying right by the opera, and within a few hundred meters of the fountain on the Republica square, the national museum, a Michelangelo-designed church, and more. Of course we got Tonys recommendation for El Bracchio, and had a good laught about it when we got out of the lobby. After reading the reviews here, we didn't bother to give it a try :) All in all, this was the best value for money I have had in a hotel. The only thing keeping it from being rated higher must be the lack of space; it's true the rooms and lobbies are small.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tinhead
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights 14th November.Bit apprehensive about booking on internet but everything the site tells you is correct.Hotel is exactly 10minutes walk from Termini (in nice direction!)and drop off point for Terravision coach from airport.Directions were good,hotel easy to find,one way street with supermarket on opposite corner and Bank across the road.OK there isn't a lift to reception which could be a problem, but not for us.Staff extremely polite and helpful,especially reception,all speaking English.(OK,so they recommend restaurants,doesn't mean you have to go!) we did visit one (Barrocho) and found it to be good,nothing fancy,but delicious food and very good prices,house wine wasn't bad either!! Room in hotel wasn't huge but spotlessly clean and comfortable,as was bathroom,and AC worked ! Breakfast room was pleasant and there was a good choice of cereals,rolls,croissants,hams,cheeses etc plus delicious coffee or tea which was served at the table (pass on the orange juice though !!) Location wise,excellent,15mins to Colliseum,about 20 to Trevi and Spanish Steps,only time we got bus was to go to Vatican,Wednesday morning you get to see (and hear) the Pope! (tip,walk back to Termini for 64 bus,that way it is empty when you get on !!) we walked back,looking at various sites along the way.If you don't relish walking up the 300 plus steps to top of St Peters,visit the castle and go up to the top,not as many steps and the view is fantastic,especially at dusk.All in all a very enjoyable few days,will certainly return and stay at Hotel Lirico.2. tips ! 1.if you book Terravision bus on internet,make sure you have copy of payment details as well as E.ticket ref.or they make you go back in terminal and get ticket (which defeats the object!!)2.Fancy a coffee at pavement table,don't go to Restaurant Washington on Via National,rip off merchants !! 9Eu for 2 American coffees..(even Italians querying their bill !!)

Reviews.Title: “Not too thrilled, but OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As most reviewers were very positieve, expectations were high. However there were some points in need of attention: - room size may vary. Our room size was so small that the twin beds were virtually matrimonial. - The receptionist keeps pushing certain restaurants thta didn't - tot say the least - appeal to me. Tip: La Carbonara in the nearby via Panisperna is excellent. - There is no elevator from ground level to the reception and the stairs were quite a challenge for my mother (aged 60). Positive: the rooms are indeed clean and tidy, breakfast is generous and the bille held no surprises. A good address for young people.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff, clean and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: tania58
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Lirico for 4 nights. The location is great beacuse it's within walking distance of the city centre and the Repubblica metro (subway)/bus station, so either way, getting around is very easy. The staff are very helpful and speak good English (especially Tony!) and are always willing to suggest ideas for a nicer stay. Even when we had a problem with transport charges to the airport, Tony sorted it all out to our satisfaction without any trouble or delay. We were a little wary of booking a hotel online without having seen it, but I'm happy to report that it was spotlessly clean and comfortable, with crisp white sheets on the orthopaedic beds and good towels (most important after a long day trekking around Rome!) Admittedly, the rooms are small by American standards, but so many other good points outweigh this. Breakfast was always good and filling, with fresh bread, hams, cheeses, etc and croissants, plus delicous Italian coffee served in numerous ways. There is nothing I can negatively report about this hotel, and would definintely recommend it and also stay there again. Congratulations to the management of the Lirico Hotel for such a gem in the heart of Rome :))

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SandyJC
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel a lot. It is well located - within walking distance of many major sites but also just a few blocks away from Termini and the buses/Metro if you need to rest your feet! Our room was quite small but very clean and the shower room/toilet was fine. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and spoke English. Breakfast was nice. Plenty of good restaurants nearby - we liked Strega (turn right out of the hotel and it's just at the end of the street) also New Mary Meeting (in a little side street off to the left of Via Nazionale). Just be warned the beds are quite firm!

Reviews.Title: “Good Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: goldenthroat
Reviews.Content: I had a small group of people at the Lirico the end of September. The location was great, and the staff (especially Tony) spoke good English, and were quite helpful. The rooms are perfectly adequate, and we were very pleased with our stay there. You should be in pretty good shape to get up the first set of stairs, but again, great location, staff, and perfectly fine!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just ended a two week European vacation with a wonderful stay at Hotel Lirico in Rome. The hotel is in a great, safe location. It's a short, easy to find, 5-10 minute walk from the main train station. Most everything (Colloseum, Forum, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain) are with short walking distances. It's better to walk and take in the great eternal city of Rome! If you go to the Vatican, the best way is to catch the underground. The Repubblica Station is right around the corner from the hotel. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Tony is a great guy and he became a good pal in our three day stay. He set up our anniversary dinner and gave us other helpful information. As far as the room, it was clean and spacious. Bathroom was clean and had a nice shower. The breakfast was good, with choices of breads, pastries, meats, cheeses, juice and coffee. We had to catch a 7:20 am flight out of Leonardi da Vinci airport. The hotel arranged for an early morning pickup from a taxi. I heard from numerous people to watch out for this, because the cabs will try to scam you. Tony promised they would only charge 50 euro and it was exactly 50 euro. Thanks Tony and Hotel Lirico! We had great experience! When we go back to Rome we will definitely stay at Hotel Lirico.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Casanova202
Reviews.Content: Good clean hotel, only 5 min walk from central train station. Friendly reception staff, and nice breakfast. Would use again on future trips to Rome. Easy to access all major tourist attractions, either on foot (20-30 min) the numerous buses or the reliable underground.

Reviews.Title: “Nice home base in Rome”
Reviews.Author: JonInDavis
Reviews.Content: Pretty good location. Rome is not as easy to get around as some other European cities, but that's not due to the hotel. Walking distance to central train station and Republica Metro station. Walkable (but long) to Coliseum/Forum (or take the Metro). Supermarket across the street was very convenient. Gelato shop across the street was also very nice! Helpful staff. Nice room. Very good breakfast (except the OJ). La Gallina Bianca is a good restaurant in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Glendir
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel based purely from comments on this website and it didn't disappoint. The staff were very friendly, the rooms clean and well maintained and we found the location to be ideal (with a number of bars, restaurants, shops and tourist attractions nearby). For the further away attractions such as the Vatican the hotel is conveniently close to the underground) although be VERY aware of pickpockets on the underground!). The free hotel map was invaluable in finding our way about and the staff are very good at recommending places for dinner, shopping, etc. In all a very good hotel and we would book this again if we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel - One Caveat”
Reviews.Author: CelticFire
Reviews.Content: We booked the Lirico solely on the reviews on TA. We have found this site always to be accurate. The hotel was easily located from Termini, Good safe Location. The Room was Clean and was well equipped-we had a triple room and everything was more than adequate. Found all staff pleasant enough-its not their job to entertain us. It was a good 25-30 min walk to the attractions but at 100 Euros/night we would have paid a lot more to stay closer. The Breakfast was more than adequate during our 4 day stay. I would stay here again ....with one proviso. During our stay the Corridor Fire doors were wedged open. I brought this to the attention of staff but it did not change during our stay. I again highlighted it on our comments sheet. We stayed in August, I would require confirmation that this practice has ceased before I would stay again. Unfortunate because otherwise it was a clean efficient hotel and would have beeen rated as above average

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Lirico and loved it. If you want a Hyatt or Marriott type hotel, don't leave the US. The hotel was clean, quiet, and in a great location. We enjoyed the breakfast--it was not an American-style breakfast but typical of what Italians eat. We never had to wait for hot coffee or tea and found the staff helpful and very responsive if you just treated them with some politeness. We took the shuttle bus from the airport to the Termini Station (the main train, subway and bus terminal) and walked the three or so blocks to the hotel. It's within waliking distance of the Colliseum and most Rome sights. The Vatican is a quick bus ride or 10 euro taxi ride. Our room was clean, the bath was clean (watch out for the bidet feature on the toilet if you're not expecting it!) and modern. The only "complaint" was the shower curtain was small. As for booking tours or recommending restaraunts, of course the hotel has affiliations. Thre are litterally hundreds of tours of all types--what we found was it was best to book them before you got to Rome. We found two great restaraunts within walking distance of the hotel. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome....”
Reviews.Author: Steve&Jo
Reviews.Content: My partner and I visited the Eternal City In March 04. We booked the Lirico Hotel primarily as it seemed reasonably priced for its' location and amenities. The Hotel was fairly easy to find and about a 15/ 20 minute walk from the Railway station. When we checked in the staff were very friendly and helpful (though this was less the case with different staff on different days). The room we were allocated overlooked the Theatre and was clean and fairly well appointed (no bath though). The only real disappointment was breakfast - quality and quantity issues! Overall the Hotel was well priced for the standard of accomodation and the location it offered. Definitely a better option for those looking to use their hotel only as a base for exploring rather than those looking to relax in grandeur.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJJS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for our last stop, in Rome, on a 2 1/2 week trip. The hotel was convenient to the train station and within decent walking distance of the Ancient Rome sites. We booked through the hotel website, and we were given the room directly in front of the entrance, which was a little annoying. The room was small, and the bathroom was very small and not very clean. The included breakfast was pretty minimal. The neighborhood was okay to walk through at night.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a little further from the sites than we had thought. We basically got off the subway and walked a block to the hotel. Very much in the city, this we did not like. Was a bit scared to walk around area at night. Hotel staff was helpful. Rooms were quite large. Not a fan of material on the walls. Even though it was a non-smoking room smelled like someone had smoked in there. Bathroom constantly smelled like mildew due to poor circulation... no window and the fan was very low functioning. The shower temperature was very hard to control and keeping the water off the floor was an even larger problem. Bad designing. Had to put shoes on to walk to bed due to the tile floor which didn't seem all that clean. Even my husband put his shoes on, that tells you something. Breakfast was ok, some sort of pastry, crackers, cheese, yogurt. Being close to the subway and train did have its pluses. Easy to take day trips and to get back to airport. If you don't mind being a bit far from sites and are used to city life then you probably won't have any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Convenient Retreat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rome is an energetic and sometimes a chaotic City but it was nice to have a convenient retreat for the evening, which for us was at Hotel Lirico. The Hotel was an outstanding value and a great location. The room was very clean although a little small for my daughter and I. Breakfast was very good with your choice of espresso or cappuccino, etc, note not a hot breakfast. The location is near the Repubblica (metro stop) and Via Nationale (bus stops), which are both excellent for public transportation. You also can catch the on off red bus run by “City-Sightseeing” at nearby Santa Maria Maggiore, which can help orient you to the City. We found that walking to the sights was easy but after a long day it is good to know the public transport back to the hotel. The more adventurous can try the scooter rentals up the street. The hotel staff was helpful with information on places to eat. The staff is happy to help but is limited in ability to help since it is a small hotel. There are many places to eat on nearby Via Nationale we stopped and ate at Mondicaffe and New Mary Meeting, which were both reasonable and very good. Around the corner from the Hotel there is a choice of two Internet cafes both were fine but small so if one is full you can try the other one. Also these Internet cafes offer low cost international calling booths. The café on Via Napoli also sells cell phone minutes.

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and me estayed in Hotel Lirico in May 2005 and we were glad to be there. Although it's small, It's clean and well located. The underground is a 3-minutes walk and there are a lot of buses near the hotel. If you like walking, yo can arrive to Coliseo, Piazza Espanya, Piazza Venezia in 10-15 minutes. Santa Maria la Mayor is very very near to the hotel. Breakfast is simple but coffe with milk is great!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: HerrPetie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights in July, and the hotel was one of the good memories of our brief trip. Even though the rooms are small, they are very, very clean. That applies to the bathroom as well. The only minor problem there was the shower curtain. It only covered about half the area it should have, so we had to be careful during a shower, or we would have caused a flood in the bathroom. Even though it was not a real problem for us (we were only there for 2 nights), it would have been good to have a small refrigerator in the room as well. Especially in the hot summer. By the way, the air conditioning was outstanding. And, the staff made sure that it was on for a while before we checked in, so it was a relief after the long trip to get there. For us, the location was also very good. It is so close to the Termini train station, that it is easy to get to the hotel without a lengthy walk. To me, one of the strong benefits of the hotel is its cleanness. The other is the outstanding customer service we received, both from the breakfast room staff, and the reception desk. It does not mean I always agreed with their recommendations for a restaurant in the area, but that's a more individual thing anyway. The reason that I praise their customer service so much is because during my travels through Europe in general, customer service levels in North America are still far from what I have usually experienced in Europe. This hotel is one of the few exceptions I have come across. By the way, for us, the cheapest rate I found for this hotel came from the hotel's own website, not an internet hotel provider. When I think about the price we paid, in relation to the prices for hotels in Rome, I am sure we made a very, very good choice, and we will be back. In closing, unrelated to the hotel, when we were going back to the airport to catch our flight home, we took an express train which should take 30 minutes because it does not make any stops along the way to the airport. Ha! It took us at least an hour and a half, and add to that at least 30 minutes for the train being late in leaving the train station! Some people heading to the airport must have missed their flights. We just made it, with not a minute to spare before the checkin desk for our flight was closing.

Reviews.Title: “An okay place, great location and some pleasant staff...”
Reviews.Author: Abby-m
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lirico from 29 June - 06 July 2005. Location wise, in my view Lirico is second to none. Just outside the hustle and bustle but within very easy reach of the main attractions including the Vatican, which can all be accessed by Metro buses from Via Nazionale just a block behind Via del Viminale, or by a short walk to the Termini, which for me was not scary as some have made it out to be. We actually found it quite safe! The reception and breakfast areas, rooms and bathrooms are small, but I believe it is a standard in Europe. Despite the size, we were comfortable and enjoyed our stay. Most of the hotel staff was friendly and very helpful, attended to our requests and addressed our concerns such as giving us an alternative room and changing the shower curtain. Thanks to Tony, he has a great personality. Massimo always helped with directions to relevant places, even for getting bubble wrap! Chan and the other young man who often worked in the evenings were great and provided us with a steady supply of ice cubes to combat the heat. The continental breakfast was adequate except that we had the same stuff for seven days and I could not have my rooibos tea. I also managed to get a good rate by European standards although I could not help thinking that at home I would have been at the Sheraton. Overall, the hotel is not bad and is recommended. I could go back... just that I like trying different things.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and good location..”
Reviews.Author: Panserhansen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days, and payed about 127 euro a day for a double room, breakfast included. The location is great, next to the opera and a 3-4 minute walk from the metro station Repubblica. Via Nazionale is nearby with plenty of shops and restaurants. 15-20 min walk will take you to Trevi Fountain and about 30 min to the Spanish steps. Staff were friendly and helpful. Our room were spacy and clean. Breakfast was ok, but after a few days we found the menu pretty boring. The chinese restaurant across the opera is highly recommended, cheap and good food. A supermarket at the corner, internetcafe around the corner. A friendly hotel well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly. It's relatively close to the train station and to Repubblica Metro. The rooms were small but you deal with it when you are in Italy but the bathroom was tiny. I've stayed in several places in Rome and this was the smallest hotel bathroom. It's mainly because they have a tub that takes up half the bathroom and it's a shame we couldn't relax in it due to the dirty shower curtain. You have to walk up a flight of stairs before you get the reception desk and then take the lift to your assigned floor. Fortunately the rooms had a working A/C and it was quiet enough at night to leave the window open. However, with all the hotels to choose from in Rome I don't believe we will be returning to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is smaller than it looks on the pictures but it is still very good value for money. It has excellent travel links to all parts of the city. The hotel arrange taxis to and from the airport. Give them a nod and you might get the price down. The Lirico is just outside the very busy part of Rome and is nice and quiet at night. It is safe around till late and there is a supermarket in the basement of the building adjacent. If you like a walk like we do, you can visit a great deal of the city on foot in afew dys. The staff are friendly, speak English and very knowledgable. Get one of their free maps of the city which has the hotel location on (saves getting lost). We thought breakfast was superb - forget the nit pickers who don't like the fresh orange - it's a bit different but you are abroad for goodness sake. Local pixxerias are good - try and go to one the Italians use - the food is fantastic. We couldn't really fault the hotel at all. If your over sixteen stone the shower might be a bit of a squeeze.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lirico for 3 nights in April. Room 216 was a good size, clean and comfortable. Staff were polite and friendly. Breakfast was ample. The hotel is in an excellent location 5 mins walk from Termini. Good chinese restaurant La Giunca on Via Daniele. Would recommend this hotel and would definately stay there again when we return to Rome. There is so much to see in Rome one trip is not enough.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lirico”
Reviews.Author: Severn_9
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night stay at the Hotel Lirico in Rome. We booked it after reading the reviews and were not disappointed. The hotel is a short walk from the station so no need for taxis. The moment we arrived we were made to feel welcome by the staff especially Toni. The room we had (207) overlooked the opera house and was a good size with two chairs, table and a sofa, very clean and the decor was great. The position of the hotel could not be better within easy walking distance of most of the major sites and with the metro just around the corner easy access to the rest. We felt perfectly safe walking in the area around the hotel both day and night and there are plenty of good restaurants nearby. We can recommend a good restaurant in Via Napoli (turn right out of the hotel, right again, cross the main road and it's straight ahead).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & a lovely city!”
Reviews.Author: kristophe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the end of January for 4 nights. We chose it because of the Tripadvisor reviews and were not disappointed. We received a very warm welcome and were recommended a good restaurant nearby which was very good as well as reasonable. The location of the hotel is good and only 7-10 minutes from the airport bus. The rooms were clean and beautifully presented. The breakfasts were adequate and the coffee hot! I suppose if there was one criticism I would have to agree with one reviewer that the beds were a little firm. All in all we had a wonderful stay and we would certainly go back to this hotel. The staff were really helpful when, on our last day, my elderly father had his wallet stolen (watch the crowded Metro on a Sunday morning en route to Vatican City!). They made phone calls for us and refused to accept payment. Great time - all the suggestions for restaurants were excellent too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelguru4u
Reviews.Content: DO NOT get off at the Termini Station-IT'S A SCARY PLACE!!! Get off the Republica Station stop. It is the most direct stop to the hotel. It's about a three minute walk. The surrounding area around the hotel can be "shady" at night. Many homeless in the area. The room was nicely furnished and the room was clean. The bed was a bit HARD! Breakfast was okay. Warning the elevator is VERY VERY VERY SMALL. Over all it's an average stay.

Reviews.Title: “4 Nights at the Lirico”
Reviews.Author: kathywood
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed four nights at the Lirico from 25th January 2005. Our room was clean, comfortable and everything was in working order. We found the reception staff to be very helpful and pleasant at all times - they gave us a map, which we found very useful on our travels around Rome. Breakfast was continental - cereal, rolls with cheese, salami, jams etc, pastries, fruit and yoghurts. We felt it was more than adequate and the breakfast staff were always quick and willing if you asked for a pot of coffee or tea. The hotel was very central and there was a nice little basement supermarket on the block next door to it, as well as a very good and reasonably priced chinese restaurant further up the road which did a good 3 course meal for about €7. We would highly recommend the hotel to anyone and would certainly not hesitate to stay there again. A great time in Rome, helped especially by our stay at the Lirico.

Reviews.Title: “just the job”
Reviews.Author: charnett
Reviews.Content: Just ten minutes walk from the termini station this unassuming hotel was just what we wanted for our stop in Rome the staff were friendly. Room small but well proportioned and the breakfast which although it did not have any cooked element was plenty for good mornings start. we went to the small restaurant left out of the hotel past the opera house on the right side of the road just on the corner, called allessio. They speak good English and the food was very tasty. for some free entertainment watch out for the ariel display put on by the birds just above the station, it is transfixing to watch as the duck dive and weave above the unsuspecting crowd. The time for this display at least when we were there was around 17:30. It goes without saying how impressive the city of Rome is but I will mention that with a decent map you should be able to walk and see a great deal of this magical city. One final point is to try the little café' just to the right of the hotel, proclaiming to have the best cappuccino in Rome. Don’t know about that but it gets our vote.

Reviews.Title: “On the fringe but good on the pocket”
Reviews.Author: shrubberyuk
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in October 2004. We booked directly through the official website and obtained a reasonable price of about 95gbp per night. We don't like to pay over the odds for a hotel room so try to stick around the 100gbp mark and for that I don't expect luxury but do expect a high standard of hygiene, a comfortable bed and a nice shower. Hotel Lirico delivered on all three counts. I was surprised and very impressed by the way in which the room was decorated (it seems that the hotel was completely remodelled a year or two ago and to excellent effect - have a look yourself on the official website). The staff were very helpful and friendly and all spoke excellent English (embarrassingly good infact). The included breakfast was fine if somewhat limited. There were no hot dishes available but there were plenty of nice local bread products and packets of Italian meat. I have read other derogatory comments about the 'orange juice' provided with breakfast I am not going to break from that trend. The orange was horrible. That said, the coffee was excellent but then this is true for the whole of Rome to my experience. Coffee in England is generally shamefully bad and this fact is particularly emphasised when you go to somewhere like Rome where they obviously take great pride in it (and justifiably so). The location of the hotel is quite convenient although not exceptional. It was about a 15min walk to the 'heart' of Rome (i.e. the Coliseum, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain etc..). I am assuming that the closer you get to these attractions then the more you have to pay for the kind of quality the Hotel Lirico gives you at a fraction of the cost. As long as you don't mind a bit of a walk in the morning and at the end of the night then you will be fine. We didn't mind. I only have one gripe about the hotel and it is a shame that it had to happen at all. The problem arose when we asked at the reception a couple of days in advance if we could book a taxi to take us to the airport. The taxi arrived on time but it turned out that he had been misinformed about which of the two airports we wanted to go to and that this would then mess up the rest of his pick ups for the night (like I really care). He then proceeded to drive like a mad man for the next half an hour en route and charge us 33 percent more than we had been quoted by the receptionist. To be honest it made me wonder whether he had a racket going with the receptionist at the hotel to try and fleece tourists as they left the country. I phoned the hotel open receiving the inflated bill only to be greeted with flagrant lies about how much he had quoted me the previous day. Only a minor gripe though really and wasn't indicative of the rest of our stay in the hotel. All in all, I would recommend this establishment for people who don't mind doing a little walking so that they can pay a little less.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: OccasionalTraveller8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Lirico in November 2004. Our room was ample, clean and comfortable. There was a bit of street noise but this could be blocked out by closing the shutters. Breakfast was basic but adequate. Located near to the beautiful Santa Maria Maggiore and within easy walking distance of the Colosseum and Roman Forum. Explore the side streets for excellent trattorias. Comfortable walking shoes are recommended for the cobbled streets by the way! There is a big staircase up to the reception area of the hotel which was no problem for us but some might struggle with heavy bags/cases. The reception staff spoke excellent English which was handy for us given our (embarassingly) poor command of the Italian language! Close to the Termini (railway station) so relatively easy and inexpensive to get to and fro from Fiumicino Airport by train.

Reviews.Title: “very small room and bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: nhermida
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 9 nights at the Hotel Lirico. I purchased the vacation via Expedia based on price and location, the pictures at Expedia and at the hotel's web site, and also all the wonderful reviews in TripAdvisor. We were fairly disappointed. First, let's cover some good things about Hotel Lirico: - The location is great, very centric and close to buses, trains, and the Metro. - In addition, the staff is very polite and they do speak English. - The room and the hotel in general were clean. - They have a decent breakfast, with Espresso and cappuccino (which we love), and bread, cheese, pastries, fruits. Now to the bad things . . . (1) Although this hotel is labeled a "three star" facility, believe me, it is not. We have been told several times that Europe has a different standard, and we always must take out at least one star if we want to compare a hotel to the American ones. Definitely, this is a 2-star at most. (2) Before you reach the elevator, you must go up the stairs with your baggage, although the hotel staff will help you if you ask. (3) The room we got had a good closet and room to place our two medium-sized suitcases *BUT* it was about 10 ft x 11 ft, and the bathroom not only was small but it had the smallest shower area I have ever seen: it was a tiny square, with an entry way 12.5 inches wide ... Both my husband and I are overweight, so we had difficulty getting in (fortunately the sliding sides were made of plastic that bent a little), and once you were inside, you were not able to bend to reach your lower legs or feet (even a small size person would not be able to do this). We thought we had seen the smallest possible hotel rooms during our past stays in Madrid and Paris, but this one beat them. (4) We did not have a working outside phone line all the time we were there. On the first day, I reported it, and they said it would be fixed. One of the staff came to the room (somewhat disbelieving me) to prove that it was not working. Well, the incoming calls were transferred, but I was unable to call outside or even the front desk for 8 days. Every time I reminded them that the phone was not working, they said it would be reset and work the next day. When I had to make calls (about 4 total), I went downstairs to the desk, and they would make them for me (although not happy at times because I was using their only phone), and one time they charged me 50 cents/Euro for one of the calls ...it was not my fault that the room phone was not working!!! (5) Since there was absolutely no space to place anything else besides the bed and a couple of tables in the room, the *tiny* TV set was placed kind of high up, hanging from the wall. The TV reception was fairly bad for most channels. (6) The bed (actually, there were two twin beds put together) was sooooo hard, it made sleeping difficult. In addition, and unfortunately for us, we got very sick with flu/fever the last three days we stayed in Rome, and we had to stay in our room. It was absolutely awful. We ached and could not sleep because the beds were like wood. Bottom line: Go to this hotel *only if* your most important concerns are location and cost and if you are a thin person. If you are looking for a comfortable stay, you must pay a bit more for a 4-star hotel (which will then be comparable to an American 3-star hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChusToni
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights last week. The room (308) was very small (in fact, it was the smaller of the hotel, so if you go, try to choose another one) but clean and comfortable, especially the 2m-long bed. The service was also very nice and the breakfast quite good. The location is fine, 15 minutes walking to Fontana de Trevi and 5 minuts to Santa Maria Maggiore. And of course, Rome is so beatiful... (even raining). Very recomendable!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: LondonAnonymous
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Tripadvisor I chose the Lirico on the basis of value for money and was not disappointed. Spent two nights with my boyfriend in early December (still warm and sunny!) for 95 euros per night. The staff were helpful and courteous, the rooms were spotless with ample space and the breakfast, though largely pre-packaged, was extensive. There was a little noise from the street below, but it was nothing if not authentic! Also, great wood-fired pizzas for reasonable prices and friendly service in a restaurant just down the road (turn right and keep going to the end of the road and it's just opposite). They opened the restaurant just for us at 4pm in the afternoon for a late lunch. Otherwise, eat in the Travestere area - much more fun. Tips - one of the best views of Rome is from the top floor of the Capitalione art musem from the cafe terrace. Breathtaking. The art isn't bad either! And by far the best coffee ever tasted is the espresso from Tazza d'Oro just round the corner from the Pantheone. Rome is fabulous. Walk everywhere and you'll discover so much.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: Narnia72
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Lirico with my boyfriend mid-November 2004. We found the hotel to be clean and relatively comfortable (although the bed was very hard and there weren't enough pillows or blankets). It is a good location - right next to the Teatro dell'Opera, so you can ask for this if taxi drivers don't know the hotel. There are also lots of lovely little cafes around the Teatro, you can get coffee, cakes and alcohol from the deli up to 2am, big bonus! Very easy to get around - you can walk to a lot of the main attractions (colosseum, santa maria maggiore, piazza navarone) and the metro stop is round the corner in the piazza repubblica. I wandered around on my own fairly late at night and felt as safe, if not safer as wandering the streets of London. The hotel itself - there is no lift to reception, so a big disadvantage if you have heavy bags. We booked via -------------- at a rate of 105 euros per room, per night, including breakfast and taxes. We found a cheaper rate on expedia.com (95 euros a night), contacted the hotel to ask about the difference and they assured us they would put us in a "better" room. We weren't; when we got there we were told that the hotel was full and we ended up in a room 2 doors down from reception. It wasn't as noisy as we feared, but still wasn't an upgrade in my opinion. The rooms are very small and the floors are polished wood, which is cold in November. The bathrooms are miniscule, and they have put a strange small bath in the room we had (105) - it would have been far better to put a good shower in. Breakfast is pretty rubbish. Everything is pre-packaged - handy if you are a breakfast bandit and want supplies for a packed lunch - but there is nothing hot or fresh (cheese and meat are all pre-packaged) and the "fresh" fruit bowl is fairly old. You are charged if you want more than one drink at breakfast and the juice is - I think - made from powder. However, I know from experience that you pay through the nose for a good hotel in Rome, and, breakfast aside, this would rate as a decent b&b. The staff are friendly and helpful, they all speak english, and the reception is 24 hour (they lock the front gate after 11pm but there is an entry buzzer). Would recommend for a weekend away, but if you were staing in Rome for much longer, it might be worth paying more and staying in a bigger hotel. The Exedra Boscara (sp?) round the corner in the piazza repubblica is gorgeous, but consumately expensive. The Hotel Capo d'Africa looked lovely (down a back street minutes away from the Colossuem), but again very expensive. However, if you were going for romance and luxury I would recommend either of these two in preference.

Reviews.Title: “On the whole a good experience”
Reviews.Author: Treylya
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Lirico in early November. The location is wonderful, rooms small but nice. The only downside was the questionable business ethics of the management. At the complimentary breakfast don't ask for a second cup of coffee as they will charge you. On the morning of checkout I asked if we could check out .5 of an hour later than the 11.00 time. I was told this was ok. When we arrived back at the hotel at 11.30 I was amazed to see our bags sitting in the lobby. The hotel had prearranged a taxi for us to the airport, the driver at first refused to honor the price that the hotel quoted. These small matters left a bad impression with me.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our party of 3 stayed in 2 rooms at the Lirico hotel on 3-6 November, 2004. We found it very clean and pleasant, excellent value, and well-located. It's in a street that is reasonably quiet, but an easy walk from the main Termini station. It's also within walking distance of the Colleseum/Forum, Trevi fountain and Spanish Steps areas (all about 20 minutes away), although bus and metro are conveniently close and help reduce leg-fatigue! In the hotel, we found the staff to be friendly and helpful, beds a bit firm, and breakfast fare plentiful but unexceptional quality. We'd certainly stay there again. Experience with nearby restaurants : Strega : was good value, pleasant sitting outdoors (in November!), average food, helpful service. Quite a lot of Italians eating there, so must be some sort of recommendation. Diocleziano (I think that was the name): was poor value, unexceptional food, annoying service, nearly all tourists (mostly Japanese), guitar/singing interludes were okay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: leuk
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. We had a large room on the 3rd floor that overlooked Opera House. For the price and the location, we thought it was a great deal for a big city hotel. We liked the fact that we could walk from the train station to the hotel without the hassle of taking a taxi or the bus. The bed was comfortable, the location great and the breakfast was perfectly fine. Of course we heard street noise when the window was opened but the room was perfectly quiet when the window was closed. The staff was courteous and made reservations for us at a local restaurant. When we read the negative reports, we can't believe that it is the same hotel that we stayed at.
